author: {'steamid': '76561197980384654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 462, 'playtime_at_review': 1135, 'last_played': 1711348486}
review:
Very cool little title, played it in 2015, just beat the shit out of it today. Grind's pretty brisk, upgrade your archers (longest range at the start of the game, 360 firing arc, fast fire) and get your party limit members up, don't bother with upgrading any other dudes until you get the witch doctors, upgrade your DPS cooldown and you're off to the races when you get the golden axe.

Go ahead and give it a go.

review:
It's not a terrible game, but there are much more fun and less grindy alternatives on the market today.

The main reason I am giving this a thumbs down though is due to how buggy Bardbarian is. The programming team did a bad job here, and if you use a controller you will have to frequently restart the game because buttons randomly stop working or your left trigger mysteriously becomes stuck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009634062', 'num_games_owned': 1057, 'num_reviews': 406, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1696476062}
review:
Give it some time to ramp up to speed, maybe an hour and a half, then choose whether you like it. So glad I gave this game some extra time. I didn't like it at first, and not a fan of the art style. But, I played it enough to see,

Its far different enough from all other titles in this Genera, which is what makes it worth your time/ $$.

The baddies even mostly shoot back. All the possible party members... good stuff. Also not a fan of the music, but it starts to grow on ya, and is... enduring after a bit.

Probably get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122703630', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1659294280}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013806302', 'num_games_owned': 3994, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1659226351}
review:
It's interesting that I decided to play this game in 2022 because it feels like the grandfather of a big hit this year, Vampire Survivors. It is not really a tower defense despite the popularity of the tag, there is something to defend but you don't build towers, pathing is not important and you are actually a target. It's closer to a casual bullet hell in my opinion. Remove the town crystal and make your units invincible and this would have been Vampire Survivors Lite many years in advance.

The game gets repetitive, especially on normal difficulty and because of the rogue-lite elements but it is short enough that it's not a detriment unless you go for all the achievements like I did. Around half my playtime is for getting enough gold to unlock everything for the last achievement.

Nice cute artstyle and it's easy to pick up that "axe" and start jamming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049743535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1653193374}
review:
A short, yet enjoyable take on the tower-defense & bullet-hell genres.
Lots of different units, upgrades and boosts. Music is good albeit repetitive.
I had hoped a game about being a bard would have more music variety, but the game is still fun.
I don't really see myself returning to play it.

100% achievements in 7.2 hours.
Rating: 7/10 - It's enjoyable enough to get on sale, if you're intrigued.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993531522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1483444220}
review:
A strange little Action Tower Defense game where you control a hero with a bunch of minions / pets who scurry around killing enemies who travel from right to left in an effort to destroy your base. 

It's a rogue-like / grind-based game where you collect gold or whatever and then use it to level-up so it becomes gradually easier to kill increasingly more powerful enemies. It's nothing special but I played it for five and a half hours so it must have some appeal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017198694', 'num_games_owned': 1997, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 861, 'last_played': 1648709583}
review:
If there were a Neutral rating, that's what I'd give this game. In the end, after finishing the game I felt a wave of relief wash over me. Some games I'm sad when there's no more to do, in this case I felt happy to be done. So I'll let that final feeling guide me here and give it a thumbs down. I had fun, but in the end I could have had more fun with a different game.

It's a very well polished and well developed game. You are the bard and as you walk around playing your music, your team of recruits follow you about attacking the enemies approaching your town crystal. Their movement is not tightly controlled but it does remind me a little of a game of "snake." As you dodge attacks your party loosely follows you. There's a bit of a trick/wiggle you do to make sure your party also dodge those attacks but there's certainly an art to it. As you play your music, a counter goes up and this allows you to recruit more units.

There are lots of unit classes to pick from but they are unlocked as you play. You also collect gold as you play and can spend it on upgrades for your next playthrough. You can upgrade your units, your personal abilities (health, max team size, song effects), and the town you're defending. The real issue I see here is that when you unlock new classes, the new ones are either worthless or completely better than the previous ones. It's not just that they aren't as good, but you are also limited to three unit classes per game, so you just don't have room to use them. While you do eventually unlock a fourth unit slot by beating the main story, you're all but done at that time.

In the end, the idea is a fun one, but the game feels a bit too passive with too little control over your units and not enough variety in strategy. The upgrades are pretty easy to get and max out quickly as well. There's an endless story mode that unlocks when you beat the game but it's just more of what you've already been doing because there are no new unit types anymore.

What would help a lot with the end game would be a way to keep upgrading your units. When you unlock the endless story mode you can do one more upgrade and then that's it. It would be nice if we could keep upgrading our units indefinitely to keep pushing forward. Two solutions come to mind. The most straightforward would be to just keep increasing the upgrade limit each new round/loop/etc. A more interesting approach would be to set up an exponential price increase to allow us to continue upgrading our units. The lower tier heroes could increase in cost more slowly so that they become viable again in the end game. It would allow us to upgrade our favorite units to crazy levels so we can play them in the end game.

review:
Bueno estamos ante un juego que podr√≠a pasar por juego de m√≥vil perfectamente xD.

Este juego tiene diferentes modos de juego pero el principal es el cl√°sico "Tower Defense", es decir, aguantar por oleadas en un mapa una serie de enemigos, mientras vamos mejorando las caracter√≠sticas de los aliados para as√≠, ir pudiendo avanzar cada vez de una forma m√°s f√°cil por las fases hasta llegar a los jefes finales de cada una de ellas. 
La diferencia que tiene este juego con otros tower defense, en los cuales tu simplemente te dedicas a poner defensas en el mapa, como puede ser un Plant vs Zombies. Es que tu eres un bardo que toca el la√∫d y vas invocando a las unidades. Las cuales ir√°n alrededor tuyo siempre y tienes que ir desplaz√°ndote hasta los puntos donde aparecen los enemigos (de los cuales habr√° de diferentes tipos y tendr√°n diferentes ataques) para acabar con ellos antes de que lleguen al centro de tu ciudad y rompan tu nexo.
La mec√°nica del juego es bastante entretenida para echar unas horas, pero luego puede volverse mon√≥tono una vez desbloqueemos las mejoras y nos pasemos la historia. Que a√∫n as√≠, como digo tienes otros modos de juego como: ir sobreviviendo en un mapa con lo que te vayan dando a oleadas de enemigos o un modo de desplazamiento de pantalla lateral en el que tienes que evitar ir lento y que la pantalla te pille, mientras sorteas un escenario de enemigos y de obst√°culos que pueden li√°rtela f√°cilmente. As√≠ como, una vez nos pasemos el juego, obtendremos un modo de dificultad mayor en el cual nos dar√°n m√°s mejoras para aumentar las estad√≠sticas de nuestros personajes e items para resistir las oleadas.

En resumen un juego entretenido para unas horas y que merece la pena xD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077656464', 'num_games_owned': 1222, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 969, 'last_played': 1610501698}
review:
Pretty decent game considering the price. It's no masterpiece, but will easily give you a dozen or so hours. From a cheap flash game, you can't ask for much more. Could be a good pickup if included in a bundle. 6/10.

For completionists, I was annoyed I had to restart progress to enter hard mode and get all the achievements. Reasonably challenging all things considered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198655669', 'num_games_owned': 2075, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1630167660}
review:
A fun and unique game where the main character is a support unit. There are 16 total units to buy and upgrade, as well as upgrading your hero and town. There's a lot of choices in this game such as which unit to pick in your squad, you can three different units and a maximum of nine, so you could have one healer, and seven archers and one tank. There are four modes, Story, Survival, Escape, and Day 2. 
Story mode is split up into four levels, Morning, Noon, Evening, and Night. In this mode you'll defend your town crystal by defeating enemies that appear on the right side of the screen and are shown as red dots on the map at the top of the screen. Day 2 is the same as story mode, but a lot harder.
Survival mode is akin to a bullet hell mode, where instead of bringing units with you, you collect them similar to objects found in Story mode and you dodge an increasingly large number of units.
Escape is where you dodge obstacles, be it lava pits or attacks from enemies. The game has hours of content and is worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061314668', 'num_games_owned': 1279, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1410, 'last_played': 1507248335}
review:
Bardbarian es un tower defense en el que tu misi√≥n como bardo es defender a golpe de la√∫d al pueblo de una amenaza de monstruos.
La mec√°nica no es de un tower defense cl√°sico o un [i]Plants vs Zombies[/i] en el que colocas unidades y son ellas quienes hacen de barrera o torreta, sino que T√ö invocas las unidades con combinaciones de teclas (recomiendo jugar con mando) y tienes que ir desplaz√°ndote por el escenario esquivando todo tipo de proyectiles y ataques para no morir y permitir que los magos, arqueros, sacerdotes...en resumen, TODO lo que tengas alrededor, ataque a los enemigos.

Puedes desbloquear mejoras que ayudan bastante sobretodo en los niveles avanzados de la campa√±a (vencer oleadas cada vez mayores y m√°s complicadas para salvar tu pueblo) o para los otros, como por ejemplo el modo supervivencia.

Tambi√©n puedes mejorar las unidades y hacer en partida un guitarreo para aumentar tu fuerza, defensa, velocidad o ponerte modo destroyer cuando se llene el indicador.

El t√≠tulo del juego no s√≥lo hace referencia a que tu personaje es un b√°rbaro, sino que todo se activa o cada personaje se invoca tras una animaci√≥n de Brad (t√∫) con su instrumento. Una animaci√≥n muy cuidada en un estilo gr√°fico bonito y simple.
[i]Bardbarian y c√≥mo Brad el b√°rbaro bardo protege su aldea.[/i]

Es ideal para distraerte y destruir cuando est√°s agobiado. Las horas de juego que figuran fueron para completar el juego al 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050338220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1643, 'last_played': 1608991190}
review:
This is a pretty funny tower defense game. 

You play as Brad, a barbarian who decides to be a bard. (bard-barian, hur hur hur)
And with the companions you call in, you can make several builds to kill enemies. 
What distinguishes this game from other tower defense games, is that you can move freely around. 

And there is of course a lot of music involved. Certainly recommended when you like electric guitar. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197988000877', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1600310282}
review:
I'd sum this one up as "Meh.". At best, I'd recommend it on sale and even then I'd hesitate. It's very well made and stylized, but the moments of fun are buried under loads of boredom.

My biggest issue is that I never felt like I was "doing" much of anything. I was dodging bullets, but EVERY other decision is either automated or takes place between games (Not waves but full runs). I start my run, summon 3 or 4 heroes and start dodging so that those heroes can gain levels to deal with the threats in higher waves.

Once you gain money you can... oh wait... you can't use that now.

So, wave after wave you dodge enemy attacks and hope the AI is targeting the enemies wisely because its out of your control. Occasionally, you may decide to use your bardic powers for a passive stat boost to your party, but party level matters FAR more than skill or tactics here. Have you purchased enough upgrade units prior to this game and kept your heroes alive long enough that they are viable here? Well then there's no need for those stat boosts is there? 

Only after you die (Seems about 30 minutes per run for me) you are allowed to take your cash to buy upgrades. These range from personal stat boosts (Like a bigger party) to a town drunk that'll vomit pools of slowness to defend your town. More importantly, you can upgrade each unit here so that maybe during your next game you'll be able to win... mostly because that high level hero does everything that you can't because you're a bard that just dodges.

This is in no way a bad game. It's a well-polished game that attempted to create an exciting tower defense/bardic RPG Shooter. But in the end, I just never found myself saying "This is fun." or "This is satisfying."

author: {'steamid': '76561198015167628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1598802062}
review:
Pros:
Cool idea
Cute graphics

Cons:
Can be difficult to see what units you've got out
Unit descriptions aren't very descriptive

Neutral:
Short (~10 hours of playtime)

I picked this up from a Humble Bundle I think but this game is probably worth the $8 it's currently selling for on Steam. You'll get around an hour of entertainment per dollar spent. Could use some QOL adjustments but as this game came out several years ago I don't think they'll be implemented. Ran into one bug with controller where I was unable to use my powers and was only able to summon units, which seemed to be related to alt-tabbing in the middle of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042499490', 'num_games_owned': 2166, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1303, 'last_played': 1561819445}
review:
[h3]Shredding the Axe[/h3]

[u]It's a Hard-Rocking Rogue-Lite Barbarian[/u], that brings a good variety of fun minions into battle, facing waves of well designed enemies. A little patience is needed if you wanna get to the meaty parts. You must upgrade your buddies in-between runs. Which is great, since you get to customize your own preferred playstyle, as all these little minions have their own unique abilities.

[u]I wish they put more effort into the Music[/u]. Could have used more variety, especially for a game with the word "Bard" in the title. When you restart, and the saaame track starts again, and again, and.. Yeah, I had to resort to other sources for music at times.

[u]I'm not a completionist by any means[/u], but this was just FUN enough to keep me playing until that 100% flag was raised. Really solid timewaster!

[code]Fast-Responsive-Humorous-Polished-Barbaric-R√∂ck'n'R√∂ll !! [/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 798, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1593789640}
review:
[h1] Information [/h1]

Bardbarian ist ein RPG/Shooter und TD zusammen ist, welches von TreeFortress Games entwickelt wurde. 

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

Ihr kontrolliert Brad, der keinen Bock mehr hat einfach nur Barbar zu sein und seine Axt nun als E-Gitarre verwendet. Und genau das macht er nun und inspiriert seine Dorfbewohner ihm dabei zu helfen, die b√∂sen Eindringlinge zu bek√§mpfen. Das Spiel kommt ohne einen virtuellen Joystick aus und ihr k√∂nnt irgendwo auf dem Bildschirm den Finger absetzen, um Brad in die gew√ºnschte Richtung zu bewegen. Ihr m√ºsst nun herumlaufen und das Gold und die Noten einsammeln die von besiegten Gegner fallen gelassen werden. Um Gegner zu besiegen, heuert ihr K√§mpfer an. Anfangs stehen euch nur Bogensch√ºtzen, Ninjak√§mpfer und Magier zur Verf√ºgung. Je weiter ihr es in einer Runde schafft, um so bessere Einheiten werden freigeschaltet. Und obwohl es nur 21 Runden im Story-Modus gibt, so sind diese nicht unbedingt einfach. Der Shoot-em-Up Teil wird dadurch umgesetzt, dass ihr Geschossen der Gegner geschickt ausweichen m√ºsst. In den sp√§teren Wellen kann das schon ziemlich hektisch werden. Einen gro√üen Teil verbringt ihr damit Gold zu sammeln um die vielen M√∂glichkeiten aufzuwerten. Die K√§mpfer k√∂nnen aufgewertet werden um mehr Schaden zu verursachen, Brad darf mit mehr Lebel oder weniger K√∂rpergeruch ausgestattet werden und Teile der Stadt k√∂nnen aufgewertet werden, um w√§hrend der Wellen Unterst√ºtzung zu leisten. Es bleibt an euch was ihr zu erste aufwerten wollt. Empfehlen kann ich das Haustier der Stadt und Leben f√ºr Brad. Brad hat verschiedene Melodien um w√§hrend des Kampfes die Kampfgemeinschaft zu unterst√ºtzen. Mehr Angriff, schneller bewegen oder ein wenig mehr R√ºstung sind m√∂glich. Alle f√ºnf Gegner darf Brad ein Solo hinlegen welches die Gegner f√ºr ein paar Sekunden bet√§ubt. Die Unterst√ºtzung aus der Dorfbev√∂lkerung darf auch nicht fehlen. Ein Fischer, ein Metzger und ein Betrunkener helfen Brad bei der schwierigen Aufgabe das Dorf zu verteidigen. 

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ interessante Kombination aus mehreren Genres
+ motivierendes Upgrade System
+ gute Spielidee
+ witzige Klassen
+ experimentieren f√ºr beste Gruppen - Zusammensetzung 
+ ca. 15 Stunden Spielzeit (akzeptabel f√ºr ein RPG)
+ Errungenschaften und Trading Cards

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- teils echt schwer

[h1] Fazit  [/h1]

Bardbarian vereint verschiedene Spielelemente zu einem grandiosen Spielerlebnis zusammen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128047458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1587600683}
review:
TL;DR - Not a good game if you like to achievement hunt or 100% your games. It's acceptable if you drop it when it gets tedious. Would only buy if it was on sale.

I went up and down with this one. I enjoyed the bullet hell/rogue light style gameplay. You're a bard so you don't attack, but you play music to summon party members and buff them through songs or upgrades. The game promotes multiple runs and that's where it eventually gets tedious. It got stale after a while especially since I go for that 100%. I came across one bad graphical bug and one small sound glitch. Finally, I caved and followed a detailed guide which made finishing the game less painful. I feel like this game asks way more of you than it has any right to.

review: Few games can successfully stray from the basic tower defense formula of a lane with some branching paths and some locations for towers. This game does an amazing job of giving you more of a moment to moment responsibility for how the level goes. Another great thing is learning effective team comps and how you should move to keep units and momentum. With a low price to begin with, its worth the buy if you enjoy tower defense games and even more worth it when on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991262582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1579749653}
review:
Really cute game that blends elements of tower defense with twin stick shooter and role-playing game. It's not particularly deep, it's mostly grinding to get more coins to buy upgrades with, but I enjoyed my time with it. The main game will take you several hours to complete, depending on how good you are. Most of the achievements you'll end up earning if you go through the whole campaign. There are also two other play modes; Survival and Escape. 

Survival is you running through an open battlefield and getting to pick up resources as you go while endless enemies keep coming at you. 

Escape is kind of interesting for a twist. You have to control your character through a constant scrolling screen and stay ahead of it while dodging obstacles and collecting coins. I liked that if you were bored with grinding in the main game you could play Escape for a bit and still collect coins that you could use in the main play mode. 

The game supports keyboard and mouse, but a controller is highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1576338228}
review:
Bardbarian is a mobile/tablet ported "tower defense", but instead of towers, you summon companions who do all the fighting for you.  You have to kite your companions around to fight the enemies, but you can't attack them yourself (but they can attack you).   

The irritating premise is coupled with awful cartoony tablet tier graphics and tablet/console peasant control scheme, which can't be remapped.  Graphics are also fixed, another clue that the developers only considered PC as an afterthought, doubling down on the very low quality of the game.   It's $8 on tablet but they want you to pay $11.50, another slap in the face from the developers to PC gamers.  Screw these guys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012679672', 'num_games_owned': 5754, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1379, 'last_played': 1562552044}
review: Bardbarian puts a unique twist on the top down shooter, in that you can't shoot. You play as Brad the Barbarian who has become sick of fighting all the time, and decide to put some skill points into the bard class. Playing as a bard is no easy feat though, Brad has no offensive capabilities and must rely on recruiting others to do the fighting. His party will stay nearby targeting any foolish enemy that comes within range. If the town is to be saved though, Brad must keep his party alive by providing buffs and keeping them out of enemy fire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067732877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1561576720}
review: Not great, not terrible, it's the 3.6 roentgen of games.  If you're willing to plunk down a couple dollars for something that feels like a somewhat polished flash game, you could do a lot worse than Bardbarian.  But the target audience is probably bored 8-12 year olds, and if you don't count yourself in that group, there are likely better choices than this.

review:
[h1]Bardbarian[/h1]

[b] Tower Defense tarzƒ±nƒ±n bir ileri seviyesi [/b]

√ñncelikle oyunu ben √ßok beƒüendim. Bunun birden fazla sebebi var. √ñncelikle kendi tarzƒ±nda yenilik√ßi olmasƒ± yani tower defense t√ºr√ºne  'kabiliyet' eklemesi en can alƒ±cƒ± unsuru olmu≈ü. √á√ºnk√º kendi t√ºrde≈ü oyunlarda genellikle 's√ºr√ºkle ve bƒ±rak' mantƒ±ƒüƒ± hakimken bu oyunda ise tabiri caizse tower'larƒ± bir nevi kontrol ediyoruz. 

Eli baltalƒ± ana karakterimizin √ßaƒüƒ±rdƒ±ƒüƒ± tower'lar sizinle beraber hareket edip sizi takip ediyor. B√∂ylece dalga dalga gelen rakiplerinizin atƒ±≈ülarƒ±ndan ka√ßƒ±nmak durumunda kalƒ±yorsunuz ve bu bazen √ßok zor olabiliyor. 

Oyunda 2 tane kaynak var. Biri altƒ±n biri de nota. Altƒ±nƒ± tower'larƒ±nƒ±zƒ±n seviyesini atlatmak, ana karakterinizin √∂zelliklerini y√ºkseltmek veya sava≈ütƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ±z k√∂y√º geli≈ütirmek i√ßin kullanabilirsiniz. Tower'lara seviye atlattƒ±k√ßa canƒ± ve verdiƒüi hasarƒ± artar. Karakterinizin kendi √∂zelliklerinde ise grubun birbirine yakƒ±n durmasƒ±, m√ºziklerin etkisini y√ºkseltme, notanƒ±n dolma hƒ±zƒ±nƒ± y√ºkseltme, oyuna ba≈ülarken ki nota sayƒ±sƒ±nƒ± y√ºkseltme gibi √∂zellikler var. K√∂y√ºn √∂zelliklerinde ise koruduƒüunuz binanƒ±n canƒ±nƒ± y√ºkseltme, k√∂y halkƒ±nƒ±n size para, nota ve can yardƒ±mƒ±nda bulunmasƒ±, yeni √ßaƒüƒ±rdƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ±z bir tower'ƒ±n 1 level den deƒüil de y√ºksek seviyeden ba≈ülamasƒ±, rakiplerden d√º≈üen notalarƒ± ve altƒ±nlarƒ± toplayan bir rakun yardƒ±mcƒ± (pet), kusarak rakipleri yava≈ülatan bir ayya≈üƒ± da para vererek a√ßabilirsiniz. Nota ise oyun esnasƒ±nda saniyeler ilerledik√ße veya rakiplerden d√º≈üt√ºk√ße y√ºkselebiliyor.

Oyunda kolay ve delice olmak √ºzere 2 tane zorluk seviyesi var ve ayrƒ±ca birden fazla oynanabilir mod ve tower var. √ñnce modlardan bahsedelim. Campaing, Day 2 (Campaing devamƒ±), Endless, Survival ve Halloween olmak √ºzere 5 mod var. Campaing modunda her 5 b√∂l√ºmde 1 boss gelmek √ºzere toplam 20 b√∂l√ºmden olu≈üuyor. Day2 ise campaing'in devamƒ± √∂zelliƒüinde ama pek bir g√ºzel tarafƒ± yok √ß√ºnk√º oyun artƒ±k bo≈ü hissettiriyor. Endless'da ise ana karakterimizle arkamƒ±zdan gelen siyah buluttan tam tersi istikamette ka√ßmaya √ßalƒ±≈üƒ±rken rakipler bizi engellemeye √ßalƒ±≈üƒ±yor. Survival'da ise hi√ßbir ≈üekilde tower √ßaƒüƒ±rmaksƒ±zƒ±n sadece rastgele zamanlarda ve yine rastgele yerlerde ortaya √ßƒ±kan herhangi bir tower'ƒ± √ºzerine gitme halinde ele ge√ßiriyorsunuz ve √∂lene dek sizle sava≈üƒ±yor. Tabi saniyeler ge√ßtik√ße yeni yeni boss'lar geliyor ve dayanmanƒ±z √ßok zor hal alƒ±yor. Halloween modunun tek esprisi ise rakiplerden d√º≈üen ≈üekerlerden 100 tane toplayƒ±p d√ºkkana verirseniz size hayalet g√∂r√ºn√ºm√ºnde bir tower hediye ediyor. 

Mod'lardan bahsettik biraz da tower'lardan bahsedelim. Oyuna ba≈ülamadan √∂nce tower'larƒ±nƒ±zƒ± seviye atlatabilir, ana karakterinizin √∂zelliklerini geli≈ütirebilir ve oyun esnasƒ±nda size yardƒ±mcƒ± olabilecek elementleri a√ßabilirsiniz. Oyuna ba≈ülarken envanterinize 3 tane (ileriki zamanlarda 4. yuva a√ßƒ±lacak) tower se√ßmenizi isteyecek. Size tavsiyem bir tane tank bir tane hasar kaynaƒüƒ± bir tane de destek alƒ±n. B√∂ylece uzun dalgalar boyu dayanabilirsiniz. Oyuna ba≈ülayƒ±nca oyuna etkisi olabilecek 7 tane basabileceƒüiniz tu≈ü var. Bunlardan 3'√º tower √ßaƒüƒ±rma tu≈ülarƒ±, 3'√º ana karakterin m√ºzikleri ve 1'i de her 5 rakip √∂ld√ºrd√ºƒü√ºn√ºzde gelen sersemletme tu≈üu. Sersemletme tu≈üu ile yakƒ±n √ßevrenizdeki rakipleri sersemletirsiniz, etkilidir. M√ºziklerden kastƒ±m ise aslƒ±nda bildiƒüiniz 'BUFF'. Saldƒ±rƒ±, hareket hƒ±zƒ± ve defans olmak √ºzere 3 tane m√ºzik var ve hepsi 10 nota kar≈üƒ±lƒ±ƒüƒ±nda √ßalƒ±nabiliyor. Hangi m√ºziƒüi √ßaldƒ±ysanƒ±z size belli bir s√ºre buff veriyor. Boss'lara kar≈üƒ± √ßok etkilidir, bol bol kullanƒ±n. Tabii ki tower √ßaƒüƒ±rmak i√ßin de nota gerekiyor. Nota ise saniyeler ilerledik√ße veya √∂len rakiplerden topladƒ±k√ßa dolabilmekte. Tower'larƒ±nƒ±z oyun esnasƒ±nda da 5. seviyeye kadar seviye alabilir  ve seviye aldƒ±k√ßa saldƒ±rƒ± hƒ±zƒ± ve kritik etkisi artarken aldƒ±ƒüƒ± hasar ise azalƒ±r.

 [b]Taktikler[/b]

1) Oyun ba≈üƒ±nda a√ßmanƒ±z gereken √ßok √∂nemli 2 tane √∂zellik var:
Bir tanesi k√∂y geli≈ütirmelerinde bulunan ve altƒ±nlar dahil d√º≈üen her ≈üeyi toplayan rakun (pet)
Diƒüeri ise ana karakterin √∂zelliklerinden olan Altƒ±n Balta. 5000 altƒ±n deƒüerinde olan bu altƒ±n balta sayesinde topladƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ±z altƒ±nlarƒ±n deƒüeri 2 katƒ±na √ßƒ±kƒ±yor. Bu ikisini hemen a√ßƒ±n ve campaing mod'da deli gibi para kasmaya ba≈ülayƒ±n. Ardƒ±ndan grup sayƒ±sƒ±nƒ± arttƒ±rma ve ba≈ülangƒ±√ß nota sayƒ±sƒ±nƒ± arttƒ±rma gibi faydalƒ± √∂zellikleri y√ºkseltmeye y√∂nelebilirsiniz.

2) Bazƒ± towerlar √ßok g√º√ßl√º ve bazƒ±larƒ± da bir o kadar gereksiz. Mesela Ok√ßu, silahlƒ± kaplumbaƒüa, hayalet gibi tower'lar √ßok √ß√∂p. Sakƒ±n onlara altƒ±n harcamayƒ±n. Abanmanƒ±z gereken tower'larƒ± sayƒ±yorum: Mavi b√ºy√ºc√º, ≈üaman, baltalƒ± viking ve ninja. Bunlarƒ± son seviyeye √ßekin, ba≈üƒ±nƒ±z aƒürƒ±masƒ±n.

3) Diziliminiz asla sadece 1 tower'dan olu≈ümasƒ±n. Size tavsiyem ≈üudur: 2 ≈üaman-1 viking, gerisi full mavi b√ºy√ºc√º. ≈ûaman rakibi yava≈ülatƒ±r, kritik hasar verir ve aynƒ± zamanda rakibin defansƒ±nƒ± kƒ±rar (√áOK G√ú√áL√ú), viking tanklar ve sersemletir, mavi b√ºy√ºc√º ise uzaktan d√ºrter ve rakibi geri iter. Muhte≈üem dizilim.

Son olarak oyun gayet g√ºzel, fikir g√ºzel ama √ßok kƒ±sa s√ºr√ºyor ve mod'lar da bu durumu d√ºzeltmiyor. Hemen bitiyor ve ba≈üƒ±ndan kalkƒ±yorsunuz. Ke≈üke campaing'in devamƒ±  olan Day2 biraz daha ilgi √ßekici olsaymƒ±≈ü da oynama s√ºresini uzatsaymƒ±≈ü. Siz benim 15 saat oynadƒ±ƒüƒ±ma bakmayƒ±n, achievement y√ºz√ºnden o kadar s√ºrd√º :) D√º≈ü√ºnce g√ºzel ama s√ºre ve i√ßerik bakƒ±mƒ±ndan eksik kalmƒ±≈ü. Genel puanƒ±m [b]6/10[/b]  H√¢l√¢ en sevdiƒüim tower defense oyunu Alien Shooter TD :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197989290281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1561679869}
review:
https://youtu.be/0HeVr-GuhtI

A fun little mash up of tower defense and team tactics. The pixel art is spot on, challenge is about right, the grind is not too bad and the sound track is rocking.

Can be played with a controller or M&K - luckily there are rebindable controls for M&K becuase they are slightly whacky otherwise. 

Only real improvement would be a more audible icon when the crystal comes under attack.  

If your after a fun little time waster with some fun memes you could certainly do worse

author: {'steamid': '76561198003164240', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1414342323}
review:
Bardbarian handelt von einem kr√§ftigen Kerl, der es mit seiner Axt-Laute ordentlich rocken l√§sst. Das Gameplay w√ºrde ich als actionreiche Tower-Defense beschreiben. So habt ihr n√§mlich stets die Kontrolle √ºber den Bardbarian, allerdings kann dieser nicht selber angreifen, womit wir beim eigentlichen Clou des Spiels w√§ren.

In jedem Level geht es darum den Stadtkristall vor den anst√ºrmenden Gegnern zu besch√ºtzen. Dazu ruft ihr Begleiter herbei, die wiederum Noten kosten. Bei euren Gef√§hrten handelt es sich etwa um Bogensch√ºtzen, Magier oder auch Handwerker. Jede Einheit hat spezielle F√§higkeiten, so baut der Handwerker etwa Gesch√ºtzturme auf, falls gerade keine Monster in der N√§he sind und auf die n√§chste Welle gewartet wird. Hier gibt es viel Abwechslung und es macht Spa√ü alle Charaktere auszuprobieren. 

Pro erledigtem Gegner sammelt ihr Gold und k√∂nnt damit die Einheiten oder unterst√ºtzenden F√§higkeiten des Bardbarians verbessern. Weiterhin k√∂nnt ihr auch die Stadt verbessern, so findet ihr dann H√§ndler auf dem Spielfeld, die euch regelm√§√üig mit Nahrung versorgen, welche eure Gruppe etwas heilt. Es gibt sehr viel Freischaltbares und neben der Kampagne gibt es auch einen Endlos- bzw. √úberlebensmodus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043495274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 339, 'playtime_forever': 1984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1420, 'last_played': 1678556808}
review:
Un EXCELLENT tower defence au concept original et dynamique !

Vous devez prot√©ger votre crystal qui subit les assauts de monstres divers et vari√©s (sacr√© bestiaire qui passe du petit gobelin lent au tir unique, au tyranoeil aux tirs multiples, ou encore √† la brutasse qui vous charge pour finir par une esp√®ce de fus√©e qui traverse la map etc‚Ä¶) 

Pour se faire vous √™tes aid√©s par des recrues qu‚Äôil faudra invoquer √† coup de notes de musiques. Ces derni√®res se rechargent avec le temps ou plus rapidement lorsque vous vous immobilisez. L√† encore vous avez un sacr√© choix de compagnons donc de synergies d‚Äô√©quipe √† √©tudier. (archers, healers, tank qui vous entourent et qui se d√©placent avec vous).

Les ennemis sortent de trois grottes : ¬´ haut ¬ª ¬´ milieu ¬ª ¬´ bas ¬ª, √† vous de jongler et de vous en r√©f√©rer √† votre mini map pour n‚Äôoublier personne. Vous allez vous balader sur la carte tout en √©vitant les tirs qui viennent de partout et pourrez utiliser 4 comp√©tences (encore avec votre instrument) pour : aller plus vite, assommer vos assaillants, faire plus de d√©g√¢ts ou un bouclier pour mieux vous prot√©ger. 

Le village que vous parcourez est jonch√© de boutiques qui vous aideront dans votre qu√™te. Soin, notes de musiques, bourse d‚Äôor, ivrogne (qui ralentit les ennemis en r√©pandant une flaque de vomi, hmmm sympa) etc‚Ä¶

Tout ce petit monde devra √™tre boost√© si vous voulez venir √† bout du cycle et affronter le boss. L‚Äôor amass√© permet donc d‚Äôacheter des am√©liorations et l√† encore vous en avez pour un moment. 

Quelques petits jeux annexes rajoutent un peu de contenu et proposent des mini jeux fun. 

On en fait relativement vite le tour mais si vous voulez creuser, optimiser, tester des compos d‚Äô√©quipe ou encore atteindre le 100% vous en aurez pour votre argent. 

Le concept est sympa, et m√™me si on peut d√©plorer l‚Äôabsence de trame sc√©naristique ce jeu a beaucoup de choses √† offrir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052007123', 'num_games_owned': 6824, 'num_reviews': 1311, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1550764025}

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1549527642}
review: Bardbarian is a pretty cool game where you basically move around with a squad of your choosing to attack enemies that are trying to destroy your village crystal. What‚Äôs neat about it is the progression system. The main game consists of 20 enemy waves, but to beat them all you‚Äôll progress a bit at a time, by dying, upgrading with gold, progressing a little further, dying again and so forth. You‚Äôll really feel the progression in the game. There‚Äôs a total of 16 different units to choose, and a decent amount of enemy variety, including bosses. There‚Äôs also a lot to choose from the upgrade store. Although most of the time you‚Äôre just running around getting close to enemies and evading their attacks, I enjoyed it. There‚Äôs also an insane difficulty mode that although harder, is way less grindier since you get gold faster. This means that the early game is actually easier, but later on gets more difficult, since you die faster. After the 20 main waves, there‚Äôs also an endless mode, just throwing harder and harder waves to see how far you can get. It‚Äôs the endgame. And there‚Äôs also a survival mode, where you try to evade attacks for as long as you can, and a runner mode, similar to the endless runner genre, where you try to get as far as you can while evading attacks. The art style is neat and the soundtrack cool, but gets repetitive fast. Still, for cheap, is a neat game that I enjoyed and can easily recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128629280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1499713776}
review: Es un juego muy completo, entretenido y los controles muy justos, es muy importante la habilidad del jugador y eso lo hace muy entretenido, si bien los modos extra no son de mi agrado, creo que la historia lo compensa gratamente. Sin dudas es uno de los mejores indies que he jugado en Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008049239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 406, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1684125708}
review:
On se situe entre le tower defense et le shoot em up ce qui en fait un genre batard ou hybride pour √™tre moins p√©joratif.
Personnellement je ne sais pas si c'est que je n'aime simplement pas √ßa ou si c'est que le jeu n'a pas les bons √©l√©ments pour √™tre bien √† mes yeux mais en tout cas je n'adh√®re pas.

On passe notre temps √† esquiver les attaques en esp√©rant que le team est un cr√©neau suffisant en terme d'espace et de temps pour tuer les assaillants.
Les am√©liorations d'unit√©s et de villes sont une bonne id√©e mais leur achat n√©cessitant de l'or que l'on obtient en affrontant vagues apr√®s vagues jusqu'√† notre mort, on se retrouve √† farmer encore et toujours.

C√¥t√©s graphismes et sons, franchement c'est bien foutu. La traduction fran√ßaise est approximative mais c'est pas g√™nant vu l'absence totale d'histoire.

Bref, y'a de bons √©l√©ments de gameplay provenant aussi bien du shoot em up que du tower defense mais sur moi √ßa ne prends pas du tout. Cela dit, objectivement parlant, le jeu est sympa et peut √™tre un bon d√©fouloir quand on a quelques minutes √† perdre.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198043815251', 'num_games_owned': 2014, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1544471200}
review:
Juego m√°s orienta a un movil que a otra cosa.
Manjeas a un Bardo, con el que tendras que "invocar" a ciertas unidades, y estas posicionaran a tu al rededor, y atacaran por ti.

El ritmo de las oleadas se hace muy lento,  (al menos en los primeros 2-3 bosses), y no hya ningun boton para acelerarlo.

Desbloquearas unidades cumpliendo ciettos requisitos, y podras mejorar tanto a estas unidades, como al propio bardo.
Textos del juego traducidos a base de google.
Te mantiene enganchado si te gusta ir mejorando cosas, pero se hace muy pesado, pues la jugabilidad es muy simple. y te limitaras a ir esquivando proyectiles enemigos, miestras tus "aliados"  intentan cargarse a los enemigos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029242857', 'num_games_owned': 747, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1536957046}
review:
You really can't go wrong with this game, and it's cheap oh and fun, a lot of fun (for those who like a fair challenge) to be more precise! It offers a nifty tower defense game in a midieval setting where you need to ward off countless waves of undead while improving your main hero, units and base (on a grinding we will go, yo ho..) and it's pretty fun regardless of getting hard(er) depending on how far you go.. Good thing is, everything you get to unlock will be yours to keep and explore forever (now how great is that)! 
The soundtrack is rock/metal oriented so for those who like house/techno etc will not be met with such pounding beats and flashy laser spectacles.. (huhuhuh sobs*..)
If you want to know more, you'll just have to buy this game and play it.. (you can even get it cheaper online, like i did but don't tell anyone else about it alright... Check it out: allkeyshop . com (<for availability and best prices)

author: {'steamid': '76561198307502258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1534896507}
review:
Firstly: this is essentially a tower defence game; you cannot directly attack, but are reliant solely on your summoned troops (referred to as your 'party').  The main difference is that, unlike most tower defence games, you are mobile and take the fight to the invaders.

Easy to pick up and with a vibrant, cartoony feel, this will have you coming back for more and you'll quickly find your party able to progress further and further into the campaign.

Once you finish the main story there are plenty of things to keep you busy: a survival mode, an 'escape' mode (basically an endless runner) and most challenging of all, Day 2.  That's right, once the main story is finished there is a much more challenging follow-up!

If you're looking for some quick-blast gaming that'll have you thinking 'just one more go', this is one of the best choices I've found, and is well worth a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131964276', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1533050104}
review:
I got Bardbarian for free and saw that it has a Very Positive rating over hundreds and hundreds of reviews. So I decided to play it instead of just farming its cards. 

I played a lot of Tower Defense, RTS and RPG games before and I can say that even for the less than 10 hours Bardbarian has to offer, it did a good job of taking bits from each genre and melding them to become something almost entirely different and its own.

What I liked about the gameplay is it being continuous. You progress on each level seamlessly and only stop when you die, pause the game or quit entirely. No loading screens, cutscenes, or any of the like. The margin for mistakes is also relatively thin compared to other games today. Get hit once or twice without using the Song of Defense on later levels will  get you killed. Moving and using your skills feels good and is fluid.

The graphics/artsyle kinda reminds me of Castle Crashers and other indie games.

The music used is enjoyable at first, but you might wanna play your own music later on.

For the story, there's not much to say about Bardbarian. One thing's for sure, you shouldn't be buying this game for that.

Go get this on sale (game's too short for its full price, less than 5 hours if you do everything right from the start) and for the gameplay. I give this game 6.5 VERY NICEs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282521790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1530461642}
review:
It's not that bad, but there are many defense games much more worthy, especially in this price range (and I got it on sale too). I got bored with it after beating it and advancing to day two. It's not easy though, played on max difficulty as it was recommended even by the developers.

This is an interesting type of defense game though.

Purchased it out of curiosity, but kind of regret it. Just not worth it at this price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971544967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1529735502}
review:
I mild recommendation for me.  The game is fun in short bursts but gets a bit repetative eventually.  But I think it was designed to be a game you play for 5-10 hours and then put aside so that is ok.

The gameplay is straightforward.  You are an Barbarian who is lazy today and so converts his axe into a guitar and becomes a bard.  Your town is being attacked and you must defend the town center.  You do this by recruiting a party (limited to 3 or 4 types) which all have different abilities such as damage, range, stun, attack pattern, etc.  Your character can also play some songs which boosts attack, defense or speed and you have one special song that stuns everything in an area but is more limited in how often you can use it.  You defend until you die and you spend your gold to improve your units, the town or yourself.  The game tags include tower-defense but you don't build any towers so I think that classification is a bit misleading.

Fun, but the game could have been better with more levels, enemy types, better campaign, etc.  Really only worth it on sale and if all you are looking for is something to have a little fun with in 15-30 min sessions.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967223692', 'num_games_owned': 913, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1529523246}
review:
Bardbarian is a game that makes me wish there was a mixed rating option, rather than just positive or negative options for the review. Overall it is a decent game, but not what I was looking for. Also, the tags are wrong. This is not a tower defense game, this is a bullet hell game where you rely on NPCs to do the shooting for you. It is ok, the sort of thing you boot up and play when you have nothing better to do, or are inbetween better games.

What soured this game for me is the grind. There are four main levels (morning, afternoon, evening, and night), each broken up into four or five smaller parts. As they progress they get harder and harder, each ending with a boss fight. The amount of customization, upgrades, and NPC helpers you have access to is great, but you will need to play the game over and over to upgrade and unlock them. When I say over and over again, I really mean it. This is enjoyable gameplay for some people, but it was boring for me. If you are interested in this game, I would suggest waiting and getting it while it is on sale.

being a leader character and forcing my minions to follow me into battle dying in droves (of 7), the art style is pretty damned adorable, and the play its self feels pretty smooth, even if i keep running into attack. . . almost like a bullet hell with out the hell. . . or bullets. . . and not something that makes me want to die. . . 

either way, it is s damned fun. i would certianly suggest it, though, maybe not at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069402855', 'num_games_owned': 1109, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1151, 'last_played': 1527867623}
review:
For a game where some 60% of the controls, aiming and shooting, are automatic it is surprisingly fun and difficult. Bardbarian is a fun and simple game. Play as a literal Bard Barbarian and summon warriors with your awesome ax guitar and than run around like a mad man trying not to die. 

There's no denying that it gets a bit grindy towards the mid-part of the game, but you tend not to notice it to much as each milestone is marked the the unlocking of a new unit giving you more advanced and complex methods to fight. Units are all colorful, well animated, and unique in their appearance and abilities so it's always fun to get into the fight again just to see what the new guy does. 

Sadly, the game is rather short and once you finish it the first time there really isn't much else to do than just replaying it over and over to level and unlocking all your abilities and units. By this point you can just about stand still, only having to move for boss fights, and the game plays itself. Even admit I ended up falling asleep several times on the game by this point. There are a few extra modes to spice things up, but they won't really keep you entertained and unless you're one of those people who just like to see their name on a leader-board, there really is no point to playing again once its done.

Still for its price the game offers a good amount of fun for your buck. Worth a pick up, especially if it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990034593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1526657060}
review:
Ninjas ! Zombies ! Ninjas ! Fini √† 100 % !

Bardbarian, un jeu cr√©√© et d√©velopp√© par " TreeFortress Games " le 1er avril 2014.

Ce jeu est une sorte de RPG Tour Defense en 2D. 
Il n'a pas d'histoire a proprement dit donc pas de but particulier.
En gros r√©sum√©, vous contr√¥lerez plusieurs personnages √† la fois afin de d√©fendre votre cristal des vagues d'ennemis arrivant devant vous.

Bien, ayant la flemme de d√©velopper davantage, passons tout de suite aux +++ et au --- !


Les +++ : 

1 / La diversification : Plusieurs personnages d√©blocables dans le jeu, plusieurs levels de personnages √©galement √† acheter, plusieurs modes de jeu (survie, course, insane mode adventure, ...), ... Le jeu est vite prenant car la r√©p√©tition est sans cesse remodel√© pour ne pas se lasser.
Un jeu court et bien pens√© !

2 / Le gameplay : Achat de pet pour ramasser l'or, achat d'am√©lioration (vitesse plus rapide, plus de vie, de d√©fense, ...) ce tower defense reprend les bases du tower defense et se veut complet quand au gameplay utilisable dans ce style de jeu. 
De plus, ayant une vingtaine de classes environ, les possibilit√©s de combos et gameplays avec votre √©quipe choisie sont monstrueux !

3 / Les succ√®s : des tr√®s faciles au plus durs, certains succ√®s vous donneront du fil √† retordre et rendront ce jeu plus agr√©able √† terminer.


Les --- :

1 / Le co√ªt des am√©liorations : Assez cher ! 
C'est la raison qui vous fera jouer 10 heures au lieu de 2 (si vous farmez les succ√®s) car acheter toutes les am√©liorations du jeu va vous demander de farm encore et encore le mode aventure !


Voil√†, au final, ce jeu est un superbe passe temps ! A n'en pas douter !
Ceux qui aiment les jeux de tower defense, n'h√©sitez pas ! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198004625267', 'num_games_owned': 3306, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1525569026}
review:
Verdict: Recommended - A tower defense combined with shoot 'em up

+
Steam achievements
Steam trading cards
Download is 96 Mb
Funny tutorial 
4 game modes - Campaign (Normal / Insane), Endless, Survival Arena, Runner
16 heroes (serve as turrets) - all of them act quite differently and suit different roles
Progression elements - Upgrades for heroes, main character and town
Actually requires some form of strategy (until you get the storm knight, then just spam those)
4 different bosses
About 10 different enemies (all of them act in an unique way)
Leaderboard
Quite nice metal-ish soundtrack
Charming hand-drawn graphics
Halloween mode (costumes for several enemy characters and main hero)
Tons of refferences to other games
actually requires some strategical thinking (resource management)
Steam cloud
Works perfectly well with controlel, mouse and keyboard (mouse and keyboard can be combined but don't have to)
No bugs and the game never crashed for me 
About 10 hours to 100%

-
About 2,5 hours worth of campaign
Lacking option menu 
Insane requires the game to be completed on Normal
Endless requires the game to be completed on Insane (artifical progression)
100% achievement is a grindfest
The whole game can be done by 3 full hero combinations (Archers -> Shinobi -> Storm Knights)
No voice acting
Basically no story

author: {'steamid': '76561198054048456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 1502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1271, 'last_played': 1553266965}
review:
Never saw a game like this before. Lets call it the most creative dodging simulator possible.
The core gameplay consists of trying to make your hero + your minions live through a storm of projectiles and mobs to ensure victory while also killing them fast enough to prevent your core from dieing.
You can decide the way you wanna try to win your wave by choosing from a palette of minions differing in Range, AOE/Singletarget and being less or more tanky.

For sure worth a recommendation
Time required: Around 10-15 hours

review:
Really funny game especially because of it's multiple references into other games, the fact that you basically just tootle your way through the game makes it unique in it's way to handle enemies and there is LOTS to upgrade, allthough it does suffer from a bit too much grinding to progress through the game, it feels like the developer wanted to make the game long by forcing the players to replay each level dozens of times instead of creating a longer, intriguing story. 
Recommended!

review: It was ok. Reminds me of Plants vs Zombies. Probably because the asthetics and the lane-base tower defense style. It's a bit different tho then PvZ. Also it's quite grindy. You'll need to put hours to farm gold to be able to get better upgrades instead of relying on skills alone. Alas, the game is not enticing enough for me to play till the endgame. Too bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990329200', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1517392412}
review:
Nettes Spiel f√ºr Zwischendurch. Geringer Umfang und ohne Tiefe. Ich w√ºrde einen Daumen zur Seite vergeben.

Positiv:

+ Interessante Kombination aus Tower-Defense und Side-Scrolling.
+ Coole Spielidee (als reiner Supporter) lustig umgesetzt (in Form von Gitarrenriffs)
+ Kurzweiliges Gameplay.
+ Motivierendes Upgrade-System.
+ Die Suche nach der effektivsten Gruppenzusammenstellung erfordert einiges an Ausprobieren.

Negativ:

- Von Anfang an muss gegrindet werden um voran zu kommen.
- Gameplay super simpel, kann schnell nerven.
- Einige Texte nicht √ºbersetzt. Beschreibungen teils auf Deutsch, teils auf Englisch.
- Geringer Umfang (in unter 10 Stunden hat man alles gesehen).

review:
Jogo estilo tower defense s√≥ que com uma mec√¢nica diferente de todo jogo de tower defense que ja joguei.
√â um B√°rbaro Bardo que usa de sua musica para recrutar tropas para lutarem ao seu lado e defenderem o cristal da base.
N√£o √© como aqueles jogos de tower defense onde voce cria estruturas e as hordas de inimigos vem com o tempo, nele, voce recruta tropas e sai andando ao meio da orda de inimigos que vem com o tempo, suas tropas lhe acompanham e ajudam a derrotar os inimigos.
Muitas referencias √† jogos famosos como: Super Meat Boy, The Binding of Isaac, Octodad.
Jogo bem rapido e que exige um pouco de reflexo para desviar dos proj√©teis inimigos.
Upgrades tem um limite, n√£o stacka por porcentagem at√© voce matar inimigos em 1 hit como alguns jogos de tower defense.
Possibilidades de criar varias combina√ßoes diferentes de tropas, um time mais defensivo, um time mais agressivo, usar curandeiras ou necromantes.

Jogo Show de Bola

author: {'steamid': '76561198044341631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1510787002}
review: Do you like running back and forth, occasionally pressing one or two buttons while npcs actually fight the enemy? Well, you still probably won't like this game. Your followers will constantly die due to the fact that they are too far away from you and get hit by enemy projectiles. Also, the only way to heal them is to recruit clerics, lowering your available damage. Oh, and the clerics can't heal themselves so you need two, lowering your damage even more. Frustrating and poorly thought out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054248266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1555281794}
review: Very fun. But it is one of those games where you might get stuck on level and have to repeat it over and over and over and over. I got it on sale. And for the price I got it - it's definetly worth the money. I get frasturated with games like this so I probably won't play this as often or for as long as other games I own but it's a great game to fire up when you are bored and have like 15 minutes to entertain yourself before you become busy again. Each round doesn't take up much time so you can easily fire it up play a few rounds and turn it off. It doesn't take up much of your time. And it's easy to play on any old computer. My main beefy gaming pc obviously can handle it but I got this for my crappy laptop and it works great there. I wonder if they have a mobile version of this game. This would be a great phone game for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263427469', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1507475013}
review:
A good idea for the game with mediocre realisation and a lack of content

This game is a mix of TD and Arcade genres. From Tower Defense games it got point A, where enemies come from, and a target B, which they are trying to destroy. This game also contains "towers", which are not towers, but units, which follow your "Bard". 

So the goal of the game is eliminate 20 waves of enemies moving your hero as a locomotive, while your units are killing enemies without your manual control. Despite moving and hiring new units you can also collect droppable items, like gold or notes (in game currency) and use powerups. I think.. that's all, what you can do in the battle... and, actually, it's enough to be satisfied..... enough until you die.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1162513909

After the death, you appear in the loddy room, where you can upgrade your hero, troops and base using gold, which was dropped from the killed enemies in the battle. Each unit has 7 upgrades, there 20+ units. But only a few available at the start. Also, there are 10 upgrades for your hero with 2-5 levels and 6 upgrades with 2-5 levels for the base. In my opinion, it's a good addition to the game.

When you finished with upgrades you start the game and.... you appear at the level 1... again. Even if you passed Level 4 in the last session... you start from Level 1.... And that's the great problem with this game. It's incredible repetitive game.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1162514042

So, actually I wanted to play further, but I didn't want to play the same levels again and again for just getting gold and I had not enough unit power to beat the next level.So... sorry, but I appreciate my time.

There are also two mine-games. First mode is endless run, classic arcade, you run until you die :D
The second is similar to main gameplay. The main difference you protect nothing except you. You will get new new unit every 20-30s. So, just run and survive.

Both modes weren't interesting for me.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1162513825

[b]Pros[/b]
- Interesting idea of the gameplay
- Nice sound design
- No bugs were found
- Cheap game

[b]Cons[/b]
- Every session starts from the beginning of the stage. There are 4 stages with 5 levels in each one. So even if you passed 4 levels and get killed by the boss in the 5th level, you are forced to play about 15 minutes in the first 4 levels before you can give him a revanche.
- It's impossible to complete the game from the first try, because your squade is weak. So you need to replay the game again and again before you will be strong enough to kill the boss on the 20th level.
- The game looks the same during all 20 waves
- Annoying delay when Bard performs 5s guitar solo after each unit summoning or using ability
- Unbalanced difficulty curve. 1-4 levels are extremely easy ( and boring because of it), but when boss comes and wipes you out in a couple of seconds....

[h1]Resume[/h1]
A nice idea for the game which was spoiled with insanely grind system and repetitive gameplay. I can't recommend it.
developer_response:
Hi, just a note, once you reach wave 5 you can begin from there. Sounds like you just didn't quite make the checkpoint! Also, if you want a quicker track through the game, we recommend playing on Insane, it offers more gold & more challenge.
Cheers,

author: {'steamid': '76561197970359498', 'num_games_owned': 1696, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1505030287}
review:
When building a new game in saturated genres, indie developers reach pretty far to find some impressive concepts to implement that make their game stand out.  With Bardbarian it seems like the most interesting part of the game, the idea that this warrior is using music as his weapon, is left behind ‚Äì making the title itself less descriptive of the game than the generic genres it crosses over.

[h1]Rock me like a boricane[/h1]

The title ‚ÄúBardbarian‚Äù had me thinking I was going to see something heavily related to music, maybe even a rhythm game.  After watching the trailer I saw that it was a good bit different from that, but I figured it would at least involve a little more player involvement than I ultimately discovered.  The primary goal of the game is the defense of a crystal, so the premise is essentially a tower defense game.  You play the role of the Bardbarian who takes up this defensive goal, except you as a character have virtually no direct influence on the invading enemies that seek to destroy the town's crystal.  You instead play guitar riffs (which consume the resource you build over time playing your guitar) that recruit people that do the fighting.  Then your task is to drag these people around letting them attack the enemy for you as they gain their own levels and lose their own health.  

The progress thread of the game is formatted in waves like any tower defense game.  Gold is dropped by your enemies to upgrade your fighters, unlock new fighters, upgrade your character's stats, and add features to the town and level.  You must make it to checkpoints to be able to start from them, which will prevent you from having to start the game from the very beginning for each run, similar to the way some roguelites work.  This design is where the game really hits its biggest problem.  It's set up in a way where you could, if it was at all possible, go through the entire game from the start, however you're easily beaten even before the first checkpoint in order to arbitrarily get the player to do upgrades.  This means that you're relegated to the same content repeatedly, not just to be able to get to a checkpoint, but to be able to gain enough gold to upgrade and move forward from that first it.  The game loses a lot of momentum very quickly with repetition, and upgrades rarely change the gameplay in any significant way.  I found myself burnt out on nearly every aspect within the first half hour.  What's worse is that they double down on that by featuring looped music and a lack of creativity in enemy design.  You end up living and dying by the upgrade system rather than player skill and that is a surefire way to make a game that slams the player with boredom.  

[h1]The dream lives on...[/h1]

I'm still going to be on the look out for developers that build good or even just average games on unique and fun concepts.  Bardbarian just isn't one of those.  Getting this game, regardless of it's low cost, isn't something I would recommend.  There are better games that cross over the tower defense and RPG genre out there, both new and old.  

If you'd like to see more of my reviews, check out my curator page here: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/EndyoGaming#curation

author: {'steamid': '76561198095392075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1503865201}
review:
Un gioco leggero, per passare il tempo, lungo quanto basta per finirlo al 100% prima che annoi.
La colonna sonora √® interessante e prende molto, tuttavia dopo qualche ora diventa effettivamente parecchio ripetitiva.
E' molto semplice, si prendono 3 tipi di unit√†, ognuna ha un costo, un punteggio di vita e un punteggio di attacco. Puoi evocarne un tot in campo contemporaneamente e combattono al fianco del bardo, ad una distanza impostata dai potenziamenti che hai acquistato. Ondate di nemici, ha un che di tower defence ma, rispetto a molti altri che ho provato, parecchia pi√π dinamicit√†.

+++PRO+++
+Comandi molto semplici, intuitivo.
+Frenetico ma non impossibile, ci sono parecchi elementi a schermo ma non eccessivi, anche in modalit√† difficile.
+I minigiochi aiutano a spezzare dalla modalit√† normale permettendo comunque di ottenere soldi per i potenziamenti
+Gli easter egg sono carini, strizzano l'occhio ma non sono in quantit√† spropositata in ogni dove
+Il gioco riesce a prendersi in giro (un barbaro bardo che suona un liuto per combattere orde di nemici?) senza per√≤ scadere nel ridicolo, anzi, fa sorridere.


---CONTRO---
-Bellissima colonna sonora, certo, ma se avessero messo una soundtrack un po' diversa ogni 5 orde invece che cambiarla solo durante i boss... l'avrei preferito.
-Non aspettatevi chiss√† che longevit√†. Una volta finito √® finito, puoi migliorare il punteggio, ma una volta sbloccati tutti i potenziamenti (una cosa che si fa tranquillamente in 4-5 ore di gioco) √® finito.
-La differenza tra modalit√† normale e difficile √® ben poco tangibile

author: {'steamid': '76561198142296127', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1455640060}
review: Another child died today Garfield. He was terrified. In that moment I wished I could merge with his fear and slip into a saccharine foreverscream. But this is my duty Garfield, have you stopped eating my lasagna? Have you ever looked in that pan? When was the last time you tasted what you were chewing? You shuffling, bumbling, crusty, dumb‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• cat Garfield. If I pelted you with rocks who would hear the dumb screams? If I set myself on fire and smothered you who would die first? You're a tumor Garfield, but God made cancer, just like he made lasagna, except I made the lasagna. Does that make me more than a man? They call you a "bad cat" but they will never drink from the fat and rotten juices, they are unfit to be in the kingdom of Heaven and Hell Garfield. You are cut from the nape of the Earth, you little bitty cat. Don't kick Odie off the table!! Gaaarfiiieeeeld!!!! You stumble home drunk and your bits are all cut away. Did you let someone get to them? Did you snip them off yourself? You won't tell me. Instead you sit in front of the telly, sagging and staring at a sitcom. Your bits are still bleeding. Chunks soak into the upholstery. You'll be fine tomorrow Garfield You live here, Garfield. You are in between the walls and the beams but you live here. I breathe you in sometimes. It makes me remember innocence. I scream and shake outside of the shower. I try to step in but I slip on a wacky tie. I catch a glimpse of you on the way down just outside of the door frame. Your smile all pus and burn scars. Whose face will it be tomorrow? Garfield, I am your keeper. I just can't seem to get a date! A thousand shifting fever dreams couldn't molest my love for you, Garfield. It runs through the wires and the cogs and the paper cuts and the plushies. It died twenty years ago. It's pumped up again from a black river bottom and vomited onto naked little bodies. Can I remove myself from its fate? They pick at you like a great big feast. Garfield, your bulbous thoughts were always clear. I just didn't want to hear. But now it doesn't matter. Now you will see tomorrow. A thousand million living things melted for you. A hundred thousand writhing tongues coming from you. It's a wonderful world and this is all that there is. Tell me you're happy, you fatty cat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062935682', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1708833616}
review:
tl;dr I find this game not great but still decent, and actually with quite a high skill ceiling that other reviewers calling this a boring grindfest might not have discovered.

Longer version: 
Having read other reviews, I started playing this game with the expectation of mucking around casually for awhile and then stopping when it gets too grindy.

However, what I found was a rather fun and challenging game with an unexpected amount of strategical and tactical depth. Take, for instance, a common complaint that the party's hitbox is too large to apply common bullet hell techniques. However, notice that whenever you about-face the Bardbarian, his entire party maintains formation by going *through* him. When that happens, the party's hitbox shrinks significantly. It's still not a single point like in other bullet hell games, but by using this technique appropriately, you can actually dodge a *lot* of stuff.

Applying this and other techniques, and abusing various enemy behaviours and unit compositions, I did not have to grind much to beat the vanilla game, though I did have to grind what I felt was an acceptable amount. And whenever I died, I did not feel like it was due to not having grinded enough, but that it was due to a lack of skill or moment of carelessness which I then wanted to immediately improve upon.

That being said, I do feel that the movement is still rather clunky, the enemies and units are not wholly satisfying, and the game on the whole is a little lackluster, which is why I think that this is merely a decent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098455928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1495661578}
review:
Pretty fun tower defense game with RPG elements. Took me over 11 hours to get all achievements as I played both normal and insane modes -- I suggest just doing insane mode as soon as you can since two of the achievements require you to complete it. The enemies are a little more difficult in insane mode, but you get gold much faster, allowing you to upgrade faster, so it balances out.

The good:
++ Wide range of units and enemy types give different ways to play and cause you to come up with different strategies.
++ The upgrade system for your units, the town, and perks for your hero are interesting and give some customization (until you just upgrade everything to max).
++ The artwork and unit designs are visually appealing.
++ A couple perks help you speed up how quickly you gain gold in story mode, which is helpful.
++ The music is good but gets repetitive after a while.
++ Full controller support.

The bad:
-- Becomes monotonous after a while. It really turns into a grind to get more gold to upgrade perks and units. To get the most gold, you have to beat the bosses, meaning you have to just replay from the beginning over and over. By the time you have a bunch of upgrades, this grind becomes ridiculously easy at the beginning levels and just a bullet hell at the end. Repeat until you get all achievements.
-- Survival and Escape game modes give different ways of playing the game but are pretty much only used to get an achievement for each as they're not an efficient way to earn gold. Plus, they're endless, so the only goal is to beat your best score or get on the leaderboard -- not a real reason to keep playing them.

If you play this game more casually, playing just a little at a time to seemingly reduce the grind, you'd probably get more out of it. Overall, I'd rate it 6/10, OK. Might want to wait for it to go on sale before you buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066529176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1482168338}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120567690', 'num_games_owned': 939, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1493576676}
review:
Bardbarian is a flash based twin (actually single) stick shooter game, where the player doesn't have to shoot (because our party members do that automatically), just avoid the projectiles of the enemies and protect a crystal at the centre of the town. The game deploys various units we can use to kill the attackers and we can also use diverse upgrades to increase our chances for success. There's a main storyline and 2 alternative game modes.

One day, Brad, a retired barbarian decides to change profession and modifies his waraxe into a lute, therefore he becomes the Bardbarian. Of course the town he lives in happens to be in danger, so he must put his new skills into good use, by playing all kinds of tunes to summon allies and boost their abilities. Quite strange, huh? It reflects the general mood of the whole game and it does manage to be amusing.

The gameplay is simple, but enjoyable nevertheless: we have to kill increasing waves of monsters who swarm towards us from right to left and defend the crystal in the heart of our town from them. Since Brad is completely defenseless (maybe turning his waraxe into a lute wasn't exactly the brightest idea), we have to summon a group of units, who will be following us and let them do the killing. This will cost us music notes (displayed with blue numbers in the top-right corner of the screen) which is automatically generated as Brad plays his lute (it regenerates faster if we stand still). This will be our most important factor as it allows us to summon units and to play special boosting songs, that can increase our team's damage, defence, speed and a special one as well (which requires 5 kills to fill up), that can stun our enemies for a short while while also destroying their projectiles.
Just left to our music notes lies a yellow number showing the amount of gold we have, which we can pick up after killing enemies. With gold we can't do anything during the gameplay, but after restarting, we can purchase several important upgrades, that will be the key to our victory. Most importantly we can unlock new, more powerful units, increase the maximum number of our followers and their permanent level (they can also gain levels during gameplay, but they'll lose it once they die) and we can also get more hit points for Brad, increase speed, music note regeneration, moreover the defense of the town can be improved by purchasing guard towers, reinforce the crystal and so on. The first thing we should buy however is an upgrade that doubles the amount of all the gold we find :)
My favourite was a guy only labeled as the Town Drunk, who runs vertically between the inn and the bottom of the screen with a mug of beer in his hand, puking occasionly, creating puddles of green goo which can slow down and weaken enemies that step into them...

There's a wide variety of units at our disposal, but we can have only 3 types of them at a time in our party (we can summon multiple ones from the same type) and it would be logical to pick the most expensive ones. That's not the case however and I found some of them much more effective than the others, but of course this depends on one's playstyle too. The best combination in my opinion is a party composed of ninjas (excellent firing speed and damage), wizards (not the black, but the blue ones with lightning bolts that can pass through enemies and have knockback effect) and a shaman (whose spear can curse, slow down and summon totems on the corpses of fallen enemies). These guys all have great firing range as well, which is very important as we want to keep the distance from our foes, since going closer to them increases the chance of getting hit and relatively good damage too. It should also be noted that they can be unlocked quite early (except for maybe the shaman). The extra units (imported from other games) like Octodad, may seem funny, but their usefulness is minimal.
Enemy units are all a bit similar (they have different velocity shots) but that's OK, they provide a fair challenge (or can be almost impossible to overcome if you have a wrong set of party members) and they are determined to kill either Brad or the town crystal. There are four bosses, one at the end of each episode who are naturally harder to kill.

The other 2 game modes are 'survival', in which the longer we stay alive against the endlessly spawning foes the more scores we get and 'escape', where we must run from a horde of enemies and dodge obstacles. These game modes provide easy way to get money for the main story, but there are also achievements related to them. I found the escape mode more effective to collect large amounts of money, but it's only true after having reached a certain length, because the amount of gold piles increase drastically as we progress after that.
Having said that most people who criticize the game have problems with acquiring gold and the fact that grinding is required. By purchasing only the necessary upgrades (the gold doubling upgrade, the gold collecting raccoon, the 3 types of units I mentioned) it can be reduced to a minimal amount and the main story can still be finished even on insane difficulty.

Controls are fine, but the use of a controller is heavily advised. This is one of those games which are quite a bit easier using a controller, so do yourself a favour by playing it with one.

The graphics is what one could expect from a flash based game: very simple and cartoonish looking (which I don't like), but the animations are funny and it doesn't really need more. The music changes as Brad plays his different songs but still way too simplistic and can get on one's nerves, the same goes for the sound effects.

Bardbarian is an absolutely fun little casual game that can be entertaining for anyone (provided they have a controller) longing for a few hours of fun and monster killing with alternative game modes.

PROS
+ simple yet entertaining gameplay
+ plenty of units and upgrades to choose from
+ 2 alternative game modes beside the main story

CONS
- a bit of a grinding is required to unlock the desired upgrades
- music is annoying 

RATING
7/10
