review:
Ein sehr simples Spiel,man rennt durch die Gegend und h√§lt die Monster davon ab den Kristal zu zerst√∂ren , dabei erzeugt man Gold das ben√∂tigt wird um sich Upgrades zu kaufen,die werden auch ben√∂tigt um sp√§tere Level √ºberhaupt zu schaffen

Wir selbst sind ein Barde der mit Musik die Truppen unterst√ºtzt uns laufen 3 Einheiten,sp√§ter 7 Einheiten hinterher die gegen die Monster k√§mpfen dabei geht es dann darum sich nicht treffen zu lassen,also bleibt man am besten immer in Bewegung.

Man arbeitet sich immer weiter vor in den Levels die zwar immer am selben Ort sind aber die Monster die uns angreifen √§ndern sich,es gibt auch Bossk√§mpfe,unsere Stadt k√∂nnen wir auch ausbauen was sehr witzig ist so rennt dann zb ein Betrunkener durch die Gegend der auf den Boden kotzt ,Gegner die da durch laufen werden langsamer und sp√§ter werden sie auch noch geschw√§cht dadurch.

F√ºr den kleinen Prei√ü erh√§lt man ein paar Stunden Spa√ü,es gibt 3 Spielarten Story,Endlos und √úberleben,sorgt also etwas f√ºr Abwechslung.


Wer Englisch kann (Grundkenntnisse) stellt das Spiel lieber auf Englisch,die √úbersetzung ins Deutsche sieht n√§mlich aus wie mit Googletranslator gemacht

Kleiner Tip

Am leichtesten ist es wenn man erst einmal eine Einheit auf +2 oder +3 bringt (+2 langt aber) und sich noch das Stadthaustier kauft auf Stufe 1.
Damit schafft man dann locker die ersten Level und auch den ersten richtigen Boss,das macht man 2-3 mal und man kann sich die Goldene Gitarre ( 5000 Gold ) kaufen mit der ausger√ºstet erhalten wir 100% mehr Gold und unsere Einheiten leveln schneller.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992886766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1439840960}
review:
Fun little game thats a mix of Tower Defense and Bullet Hell. The gist of the game is you have to defend a town from huge waves of enemies and while you, the Bardbarian, don't actually attack anything, you will summon and buff a large assortment of minions with the power of ROCK! All the while you'll be dodging and weaving through enemy shots as your minions unload hell into the baddies!

From the lightning bolt firing Wizard to the stun hammer tossing Dwarf, you'll find tons of combo choices of units to best suit your style! All sorts of upgrades as well will keep you playing as its rather addicting to unlock and upgrade everything!

Une bonne dur√©e de vie pour les fans du genre ( le temps de tout d√©bloquer et de tester d'aller le plus loin possible dans le mode hardcore et de faire les hfs il faut bien compter 30 heures de jeu ) et une dur√©e de vie correcte pr les autres : 10 heures gd max pr plier le mode normal ms bon au prix du jeu c'est toujours ca.
En r√©sum√©, un bon rapport prix/dur√©e de vie et un concept sympa pr les fans du tower-defense ( meme si on regrettera qd meme qu'il s'agisse d'un simple portage sans trop de modifications ) sinon pour les autres achetez le plutot en promo sinon vous allez trouver l'exp√©rience un peu ch√®re ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198011564736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1439234534}
review:
This is a pretty simple and fun title. You are a bard who builds his team out of warriors, archers, wizards or even mechanical turtles to defend your city. It is attacked by waves of diversified enemies, which gain in power every consecutive day.

While playing different war tunes to raise your team‚Äôs attack damage or restore their health points you battle bosses, level up, collect gold and unlock new companions. 

The goal is pretty straightforward: survive until the monsters fuck off, but prepare to farm much gold as the game is rather difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065925219', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1434639125}

author: {'steamid': '76561198163052647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1465606951}
review:
[h1] Un juego que te envicia con trampas	[/h1]
Bardabarian es un juego con una premisa simple, algo extra√±a al principio pero a los pocos minutos le tomas el hilo y entiendes de que va la cosa, con un estilo entre mezcla de tower defense y un sistema de compra rpg uno facilmente se envicia con el juego, el problema viene cuando los enemigos son muy fuertes, el oro muy poco y las mejores insuficientes, esta es una adaptacion de un juego de movil, no dudaria que tuviera la opcion de microtransacciones para poder comprar todo de tiron, s√≠ es divertido, pero es mas estresante que divertido, en resumen te hace jugar un mismo nivel 30 veces para poder juntar el oro comprar las mejoras que creas necesarias, jugarlo de nuevo darte cuenta que esas mejoras no son las indicadas para el nivel y jugar otras 30 para intentar comprar las que si lo son, el juego tiene cromos, si esta en oferta es una buena opcion para jugar a ratos en esos dias muertos oh ratos de ocio, pero no lo recomiendo para tratar de pasarselo al momento pues sera una tarea muy frustrante.
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197990539789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1236, 'last_played': 1426840519}
review:
This is more like a tower defense game without towers.... 

The core game is... protect your home.
Add new people to your crew to have more fire power.
Get money.... and upgrade yourself as the character that fight with you.
It's a very basic game and very fun to play if you ask me.
There is no multiplayer so singleplayer only.
Controller is supported... I prefure the Xbox 360 controller.

I give it a 7/10 score.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033894214', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1438301536}
review:
Jogo viciante!
Comei a jog√°-lo ontem e s√≥ consegui parar quando o terminei.
Foram 6 horas com um breve intervalo para o lanche.
Jogo muito bacana! Te prende a aten√ß√£o e a medida que voc√™ vai coletando moedas consegue comprar melhorias para os personagens e o jogo mesmo, como a prote√ß√£o para a torre.
Os gr√°ficos s√£o muito legais, a trilha sonora √© boa e a jogabilidade tamb√©m. E o jogo vai ficando dif√≠cil a um n√≠vel desafiador que te induz a jogar ainda mais.
As conquistas Steam dispon√≠veis te garantir√£o ainda mais horas a jogar, mesmo ap√≥s termin√°-lo. Terminei (zerei) o jogo, coletando todos os personagens secretos que est√£o dispon√≠veis, e ainda assim estou com 68% das conquistas. Agora √© tentar complet√°-lo no modo dif√≠cil (+21 years old), que s√≥ √© disponibilizado ap√≥s zer√°-lo pela primeira vez.

Agora com o modo ainda mais dif√≠cil, acredito que para conseguir termin√°-lo ser√° necess√°rio pelo menos 1 semana. Isto jogando muito, todos os dias. Dedicando mesmo!
Cheguei a experimentar este novo modo desbloqueado e digo: √© tenso! Arrisco a dizer que √© 500% mais desafiador do que o primeiro. N√¢o √© imposs√≠vel. Longe disso! Mas √© uma excelente oportunidade de voc√™ se testar t√©cnicamente.
Pode comprar este jogo sem medo! √â um √≥timo investimento!

author: {'steamid': '76561198112810429', 'num_games_owned': 2594, 'num_reviews': 578, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1437536570}
review:
Yet another port of mobile casual game where you need cerebellum, not brain.
Only this one is of good sort. While it's not even pretending to be original, this mix is nice from every angle (if you'll not be looking for too long).

You'll be playing for the partygoer who can't fight monsters himself, but good at avoiding hits and making friends. And with help of those friends you'll be defending your village from the onslaught of gremlins, lizards, beholders... and so on. The main catch of this game is that those Bard's friends acts very differently, so you can develop various tactics of the best team around you. Some of those helpers will be taking damage, some - dealing it to the enemies, but it's only for start! An engineer, per example, will be setting shooting towers, so for some time you can play it as basic tower defence game - two engineers in your team can overrun almost everything in the first half of the game! Glory to the engineers!

And glory to the rock music!

But seriously, it's a short break game. It can create some fun, but it's a very simplified game experience. I cannot praise that game highly, despite the fact it is a well made stuff. I'll mark it as 7/10. You surely can buy Bardbarian in some bundle, or with good discount, and spend 3-4 hours of your time. Just don't overdo it. It is mobile casual, and not a chess game. Timekiller.

review:
Finally got my 100%.

Fun game.

If you can handle normal, chances are, you can handle insane mode.

The game is best completed on Insane mode, since you are going to have to complete in on hard mode even after you complete normal mode anyways (For 100% achievement).

Starting on Insane actually seems better, because you earn gold way faster and can upgrade your units sooner than on normal.

review: I really enjoyed this game. I like games where you can grind gold and other stuff and then upgrade your units, hero, town... . It is short but good, just like games should be. In the game itself you have to protect your town crystal and try to not die. You have to fight the incoming waves of always getting stronger enemies. What I also like is that you can fairly achieve all of the achievements to get the 100%. I strongly recommend this game, especially because it is not that fame.

review: I bought this game on sale and I barely payed a dollar for this game. review:
Awsome? Check!
Fast? Check!
Metal? Check!
Grind? Check!

Run, grind, play the lute..√§h...axe...√§h...kill¬¥em all!


If you like Dungeon Defenders and Br√ºtal Legend this game will provide enough fun to kill your time in an fast paced awesome way.

+simple controls
+likeable soundtrack
+3 diffrent game modes
+funny units
+fast leveling

-soundtrack might get annoying over time due to the fact that only one song is played in a  loop
-missing customizition

Fun little game to kill your time with, if you enjoy killing wave after wave of tiny little monsters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137065965', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 1026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1026, 'last_played': 1435859575}
review:
Buy it for cheap, never at full price, here's why:

PROS: 
*it's fun
*cool idea of leveling up attributes, minions, and your town and NPCs
*100% achievements is possible
*diverse unit composition, can try different combos to spice it up

But CONS:
*music (it's the same 45 second tune on loop for the WHOLE game)
*100% achievements possible, but you'll want to punch something doing it
*no replay value past 100% achievement score. there's nothing to do after the 8-12 hour farm
*it's the same thing over and over for the most part

author: {'steamid': '76561198078993075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1455047270}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040688613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1446875194}
review: "Bardbarian" Is a fun fast paced party shooter with play styles much like a mobile tower deffence. The gameplay is fun and exciting and very fast paced. Some situations can literally put you in bullet hell firestorm adding to the intensity. The upgrading system awesome, their are so many upgrades! There are a few different play styles included in the game, aswell as what seem like an endless gameplay mode after the game is beat bosses and minions double up and become stronger. There are several different kinds of enemy which provides for much diversity. There are also a lot of different kinds of party members to be used that helps make the playing experience that much more unique. Graphics are pretty well done, vibrant good clean coloring. Sound fx are basic, music is fair but i would've loved to hear a more intense sound to the music aspect but eh. Pretty fun addicting game and well worth the play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198103088201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1434587409}
review:
I usually avoid games with the Tower Defense tag, but this one looked interesting and I enjoyed it more than I expected.

I played it on a large screen with an Xbox 360 controller.  The game was well-suited to living room play and I'd recommend playing it that way if you can.

The variety of units is good and allows some customization of your party.  You start with basic units like an archer and a brawler, and can unlock more specialized units like healer, tank, ninja, etc.  All of the units I tried seemed like they would be useful in the right circumstance.  My favorite was the necromancer - she raises the dead, who can be used as an unwilling meat shield in front of your party.

review:
[h1]Kid-Friendly:[/h1]
Yes. Get them to help you solve the puzzles. Let them feel like champs!

[h1]Kept/Removed:[/h1]
KEPT. A game definitely worth your time and money especially if you are a puzzle platformer enthusiast.

[h1]Good/Bad:[/h1]
Another Perspective teaches you how it‚Äôs world works slowly and beautifully which is an one of the tying elements that helps this game belong in your library. Although a relatively short game, due to the fact that completed the main game not over an hour in one sitting, it is still very satisfying ‚Äì the hook is there and it will keep you hooked until you solve your way through.

[h1]Last Thoughts: [/h1]
It reminded me of Braid a lot due to its overall vibe. And then with the swapping system, it felt like a Mario & Luigi game, which is a good thing to feel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027483587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1433814369}
review:
This is an incredibly fun game. To me, it feels kind of like a blend of Binding of Isaac/Robotron type 'bullet hell' mixed with tower defense. You move the Bardbarian around but he doesn't actually do any attacking himself. You have sidekicks (of different types) who follow you in a tight formation, doing the attacking for you. You move around, helping the group avoid bullets and enemies, playing songs (in true Bard fashion) to inspire their attack, speed, and/or defense. 

It's really quite a clever way to make an action game where you truly play as a Bard. I only have 2 hours in right now, but I know there will be many, many more put into this gem.  Here's some gameplay footage: https://youtu.be/1JgrTIfzlK8

author: {'steamid': '76561197974183287', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1423752949}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062822964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1433815355}
review:
Bardbarian is a fun little game that dips into fingers into many genres of gaming for a nice mixture. Featuring elements of RPG. bullet hell, and tower defense we get a near perfect mixture.

The gameplay is to protect your gem from waves of enemies. Your character doesn‚Äôt do the attacking however, he has a magic guitar he plays and has the ability to summon an army of characters to fight his battles for him and follow his every footstep. He also has the ability to cast spells like protect him, make him army stronger or speed him up as well. With a wide cast of unlockable characters it does add replay value trying to create the best lineup you can to progress forward in the game.

It‚Äôs a simple game to play and will only take a few minutes to learn all there is you need to know. The graphics are catoonish and fit perfectly and the music does a fine job as well with what is going on. Control wise it‚Äôs smooth and I never had any issues during game play with it.

You can breeze through the game in a few hours but thankfully the replay value does make you want to come back for some quick sessions here or there.

For having one map and a very simple premise Bardbarian turned out to be a fun small game to kill time on. I recommend it to most fans of any genre the game lends itself to.

 

Score :

 

8/10

http://apocalypticdemise.com/2015/05/31/bardbarian-review/

author: {'steamid': '76561198017271295', 'num_games_owned': 1087, 'num_reviews': 483, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1420069507}
review:
Vous recrutez et dirigez une escoude de diff√©rents guerriers qui va automatiquement attaquer les ennemis se trouvant √† port√©e et qui d√©boulent par vagues. 

Au d√©but, on essaye de tirer partie des diff√©rentes classes, on pense qu'il y a de la strat√©gie, mais en fait non. On finit par se faire une √©quipe enti√®re de "chevaliers qui lancent des √©p√©es" (je sais plus le nom) et on se contente d'esquiver les attaques. 

Le genre de jeu √† la con qui repose sur un sch√©ma ultra r√©p√©titif bas√© sur le farming de ressource (des pi√®ces), l'achat d'upgrades et ainsi de suite. Comme d'habitude, une fois la boutique d'item totalement vid√©e, on d√©sinstalle le tout et on passe √† autre chose. Un peu d√©bile mais fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015171654', 'num_games_owned': 1083, 'num_reviews': 308, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 30, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1711496981}
review:
This is what D&D is missing. A Barbarian turned Bard that gets units to fight for him by playing sick riff after riff on his sweet axe. 

It's a fairly simple and repetitious game. Bad guys come in waves to try and attack the town crystal while you and your units try to defend it. You use notes to summon units as well as power ups and can collect them and coins from fallen enemies. This is a whole day affair and is broken up into parts. For instance if you completed Morning but died or needed to quit the game, you can skip that phase the next time you play and go on to Afternoon. You can also buy upgrades that will help you achieve victory like a town drunk that spews on the ground to help slow enemies or better barracks and colleges for your units so when they come out of them, they are a higher level and will do more damage. However, you can only buy upgrades after each death or else the coins you collected will disappear. This goes for unused notes as well. 

It's a cute game, a little frustrating, and a great time killer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056407410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1433262483}
review:
Un jeu qui change des tower defense classiques, sur un rythme plut√¥t entrainant.
On invoque nos alli√©s en naviguant entre les tirs adverses.
On peut booster a peu pr√®s tout quand on a l'or disponible (et la hache qui double les gains surtout).

Pas mal d'unit√©s disponible pour finalement que 3 places dans les choix, et les unit√©s cross overs ne sont pas traduites.
Et je pense que la dur√©e de vie est limit√©e, mais c'est quand m√™me un "oui" pour ma part.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016179939', 'num_games_owned': 2437, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 1045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1432305943}
review:
In Bardbarian, you play as a barbarian whose dream is to become a famous hard rock bard. As such, you hang up your axe and arm yourself with an, um... axe, and enlist the help of your friends to battle alongside you to protect your town. 

This game is really cute and there is loads of replayability with there being several different game modes as well as two levels of difficulty. 

The graphics are cartoony, with the animations well done, and even though it's all set in the same place, the backdrop doesn't seem to get boring. 

I highly recommend this game if you want something to do for half an hour or so at a time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980259241', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1429382633}
review:
My wife bought this for me and surprised me with it while I was feeling crummy. It was definitely a pleasant surprise. Allegedly, she got it for around $1.00, so the stakes weren't high if it turned out to be not the best. I will say that it was absolutely worth $1.00, but I'm not sure if its worth almost $10. I got every achievement except one by playing for less than fifteen hours. Doing so involved beating the game on both difficulties (Insane and Normal). Maybe if it had multiplayer (though I'm not sure what that would look like), it would have more replay value, but I pretty much played it to completion. 

I really enjoyed it, so I even went back and beat it with a couple different team configurations than I did the first two times. After doing so, though, it does start to get repetitive (especially the music, which is good, but can grow to be annoying after multiple hours of play). If you can get it for five bucks or less, I'd recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966022897', 'num_games_owned': 3302, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1419713466}
review: Tower Defense games are a dime a dozen, but this one makes it new and fun.  You essentially control a mobile cluster of towers that follow you around and attack anything nearby.  The best way to describe it is Plants vs Zombies, if you remove the lanes, and can move freely around to attack the waves of invaders.  Great game, lots of powerups to purchase and characters to unlock each with their own pros and cons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002460495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1561768443}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072797538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1613455178}
review: Bardbarian, is a hard to pin-down game. Is an RPG? not really since it lacks some core mechanics of that. is it a Tower Defense game? again, not really, since there are only two ttowers, and they are only available in pre-chosen locations during the late game(or early game if you grind). however, that matters not, as it is a great game, with a mix of skill and grinding required though. I could say more, but i can't think of anything, so just go play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042816315', 'num_games_owned': 809, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1428053087}
review:
I'd have to say this game is very fun. I was very pleased to buy this game and look forward to playing much more. Singleplayer mode's in this are fantastic and is very controller friendly. The description of the game tells you alot about it and manages to nail each word. From the art, to bosses, to looting gold. The simple storyline of Brad is also fantastic and you soon forget that you are the one leading. The crossover content is a big win & love not just the art, but SFX and music is very good too. The game is put together very well & Co-op features would be a real big seller. Workshop if they add it would spice up even the spicy'es of dishes.

I highly recommend this game, especially for that cute, adorable, silly ratcoon :)

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995224666', 'num_games_owned': 3504, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1705097393}
review:
Bardbarian is a squad-based bullet-hell tower-defense rouge-like loot-questing role-playing game. If any two of those hyphenations sounds like your bag, then give bardbarian a look.

But seriously, Brad the Barbarian wants to be a bard, so he fashions his axe into a magic lute that he uses to summon and strengthen companions who wield actual weapons. Your "squad" will follow you around like "options" in a Gradius game, shooting at targets of opportunity while you guide them around fireballs and (eventually) lasers. Enemies emerge from three paths in the forest and shamble down pathways trying to reach and destroy the crystal in the center of town. When you inevitably fail, use the gold the goblins and skeletons and such drop to buy gear, upgrades and enhance your skills, then go out and do it all over again. There's also a Survival Mode and a Marathon Mode.

So like I said: Bardbarian is a squad-based bullet-hell tower-defense rouge-like loot-questing role-playing game. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198074672646', 'num_games_owned': 6653, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1424729006}
review:
[h1]Bardbarian vous fait jouer un viking qui combat les m√©chants avec de la musique[/h1]


Combattre les m√©chants qui veulent envahir votre village avec de la musique, c‚Äôest la d√©cision que vient de prendre votre guerrier, Brad le barbare. Mais, rassurez vous, son instrument de musique est magique et il va en faire pleurer des ennemis !

Avec son instrument de musique, Brad va pouvoir invoquer un archer, un bagarreur et un magicien noir. Tous (et bien plus d‚Äôautres par la suite) vont le suivre dans ses escarmouches contre l‚Äôennemi.

Vous l‚Äôavez compris, Bardbarian est un jeu de d√©fense. Vous devez emp√™cher toutes les forces ennemies de d√©truire le cristal qui tr√¥ne sur la place du village.

Pour cela, tous les moyens sont bons et il faudra montrer aucune piti√©.

Le prix du jeu est tr√®s correct et est √† moins de 10 euros.

[url=www.graal.fr/2015/02/26/test-bardbarian-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour d√©couvrir l‚Äôensemble de mes impressions sur Bardbarian.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198122581768', 'num_games_owned': 1493, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1480599448}
review:
Not a bad game but its suffer a great amount of farming and level up your upgrade and stuff......which is pretty boring after a while.

Gameplay is very simple but yet different than normal tower defend games as you control a hero which can call for unit to help you. But its more of a bullet-dodging game as you barely do anything except dodging stuff. The amount of upgrade and overall unit is good but not best because of limited number of unit, hoping to have a lot of combination of unit i can use at the same time. Graphic is cartoonish style, simple and clean.

Price-wise, for several hour i think its not that bad. Good if you have some hours to kill,

author: {'steamid': '76561198014445897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1425328200}
review:
8/10

An incredibly fun game. It feels a lot like a combination of tower defense and arcade games... As if it would be a tower defense game, except you have to move the "towers" around with you while making sure that not only enemies don't reach their target but also that you and your "towers" survive too.

There's a large ammount of characters to use and a lot of different strategies with combining different characters and plenty of unlockables and upgrades will keep the game fresh for a long time. Other gameplay modes adds a bit more variety and Insane difficulty adds quite a lot of challenge while also not being impossible to beat.

If there's ever a second Bardbarian game, I'd love to see a longer campaign and perhaps multiplayer!

review:
Having been given this as a gift I was sceptile ... I don't really like Tower Defense games at all and for a while decided not to even install it, but since it offered Steam Cards that I could sell and make a small profit on I thought I would give it a try.

Glad I did, have really enjoyed this first hour of gameplay and found it entertaining, the best Tower Defense game I have had the pleasure of trying!

Will not be uninstalling as originally intended but keep it for occassional gameplay!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991103051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 252, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1425102842}
review:
Its a mobile game ported to PC without much addition from what I can tell. Youre playing one map over and over with very slow progression (unless you play one insane mode apparently.) It starts out pretty fun but quickly becomes repetative and boring. Youre going to have to replay the same bit over and over and over to upgrade your units to advance.

There isn't much skill involved. Its mostly just a level your guys higher than what you are fighting and you win.

I would have liked to see different parts of the town for each section to help vary it up a bit. It would have also been nice to have something for the player character to do as youll just be running around letting the npcs do all the work.

The soundtrack is good but its just that. A track. As in singular. It plays on repeat the whole game and gets old pretty quick.

All in all I dont feel the game really belongs on PC with the minimal effort put in to the port. It wears its welcome out realy quick. However, I would imagine it would be alright in short 10 minute bursts on the toilet. So if your pc is in the water closet then go for it I guess?

author: {'steamid': '76561198100451955', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1423360021}
review:
Tons of fun for people who likes Tower Defense games, I think it's great, 8/10!

Ever wonder what Plants vs Zombies might be like if you could move through the garden? WONDER NO MORE! Bardbarian is labeled as RPG-Strategy and it's true, you can take up to 4 different units to battle and as you progress you upgrade your favorite units abilities and more unit slots (only 4 kinds at  a time, but you can summon multiple units later on).

But Hot, why did you talk about Tower Defense you drunk Batman?! Well, there are 3 lanes of enemies and you must manage to kill each one of them with your units, you can chose which units to summon and when to play a guitar solo to give them different boosts (speed, defense and attack), so it's like chosing which tower/champions to use and upgrade to progress more.

As a final thought, to enjoy more the game aim for the Golden Axe Upgrade as soon as possible to get double gold and kill all the Bosses you can! Then chose the 3 units that suit the most your playstyle and focus on upgrading them, I suggest one long range, one mid and the last one is up to you, just try to not take too many glass cannons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057849814', 'num_games_owned': 1158, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1424226543}
review:
[h1]AT A GLANCE[/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*] [b]Game Name:[/b] Bardbarian
[*] [b]Original Release:[/b] 2014
[*] [b]Genre Tags:[/b] Defense; Strategy; RPG; Casual; Musical  
[*] [b]My Overall Grade:[/b] A-
[*] [b]Estimated Playtime (Campaign):[/b] 3-7 hours
[*] [b]Multiplayer Aspect:[/b] None
[*] [b]Recommended To:[/b] Established fans of the genre; Those intrigued by the genre; Novelty seekers; Casual gamers
[/list]

[h1]REVIEW[/h1]
[b]Bardbarian[/b] is quite the fun game.  It blends elements of tower defense, RPG, action-strategy, and bullet-dodging to form a short-and-sweet little game.  Personally, the game felt a lot like the ‚ÄúProtect the Queen‚Äù games I used to play on [i]StarCraft[/i] custom maps.   There are no truly innovative mechanics to the game, but the way the pieces come together do manage to form a game that has a strong charm of novelty.

The game is short.  It took me just under 5 hours to earn all achievements.  That‚Äôs OK though, because it was a fun 5 hours and I didn‚Äôt really need any more.  If you find yourself wanting more you can compete on the leaderboards.
 
Also, the game is casual.  Even on the ‚Äúinsane‚Äù difficulty, the game becomes simple once you‚Äôve bought enough upgrades.  As someone who enjoys casual games, I really felt the balance of difficulty in this game was very enjoyable.  You have to pay attention and play, but you won‚Äôt ever find yourself frustrated.  Having said that, people who like very difficult games may find themselves left wanting by [b]Bardbarian[/b].

The gameplay itself is extremely simple.  You‚Äôll have it all figured out in the first minute and it won‚Äôt change much after that.  There are new units and upgrades which you unlock that spice things up as you progress.  But I will admit, the content is rather limited.

The graphics are "cartoonish" and simple, but they fit the atmosphere.  The music is not bad by any means, but I felt it could have been a little more epic and various considering the game has strong musical undertones.   The controls are fluid and intuitive.  The game is stable; I experienced no glitches or crashing.

In summary, I would say [b]Bardbarian[/b] is very fun and worth playing.  It‚Äôs simple enough that almost anyone should be able to enjoy the gameplay.  If you are itching for something fresh and a little different you can probably get some fun out of this game.

[i][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/murphyslawyercuration#curation]Follow my curation page to see more of my recommendations![/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197995158485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1059, 'last_played': 1465679354}
review:
A cute little game with the addictive qualities of both tower defense and bullet-hell games.
=-=-=-=-=

ADORATION:
Great Price, 
Excellent Replay Value, 
Leaderboards kept on Steam, 
Charming and colorful, 
Plenty of gameplay time for my $8. 
"Tower Defense" rather cleverly combined with "Bullet Hell" tactics.

CRITICISM:
I know its also a bullet-hell game, but the tower defense bit is badly balanced. I was juggling the toughest enemies in the game with push-backs and stun before it was even close to over. Waves 1-18 are child's play, and then 19 and 20 will kick your ass if you don't have a balanced party of stuns, slows, and push-backs at your desposal. I felt too powerful most of the time in Normal Mode, making it feel kind'a grindy.


TIPS TO THE UNWARY:
-Skip normal mode and play on insane. You'll do less gold-grinding that way, and the game is actually better balanced. You also won't have to play the game twice to get all the achievements. (I got all but one)

-Don't forget to SCROLL DOWN in the unlockables and permenant upgrades screens. I didn't get the "double your gold" item until almost the very end, and felt very much the fool for it.

-The wizard's pushback/stun is the most potent thing in the game. Upgrade him early and JUGGLE all your enemies!


TDLR:

Definitely recommended! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198032183811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1442257481}
review:
Bardbarian manages to give something new in the tower defense style games, while being fun and chalenging. The graphics are nothing great, they are flash based, the music while not bad starts to become repetitive because there is only one track at the hordes. Gameplay is where you'll find the fun here. You control the bardbarian Brad, and you summon an assortment of other units to help  you deal with the hordes while defending a town crystal from being destroyed. The units you summon while follow your steps and auto atack enemies based on their range and abilities.

You have tons of upgrades to the units, town and Brad himself wich you unlock with money from the loot of your runs.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198009952726', 'num_games_owned': 1658, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1420162535}
review:
Great and very addictive simple indie game with few RPG elements. Honestly one of the best indies i ever played. Got it from bundle, but i need to admit that ¬£5.59 is not much for such production. Anyway I'm a bit sad, because Bardbarian lacks of replayability, which is really needed in this genre in my opinion. Didn't really like the survival mode, but who cares when the main features are fantastic.

So if you didn't get it yet, i can strongly recommend Bardbarian to all RPG/tower defence fans, especially if you are bored and willing to have some fun.

My rating: 85/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198000861562', 'num_games_owned': 3271, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1428616358}
review:
I actually lanched this game to get the trading cards that comes with it. I tried the game out and im surprised on how good it is. You play through levels, kill enemies and try to defend your throne. When you kill creeps they drop gold, which you can use to upgrade your followers health, damage, etc. 

The graphics are okay. Looks like a cute cartoon-ish style, almost like a mobile game. The game runs fine though and the PC port seems to be solid in every way. Since there's a lot of grinding involved in this, you might wanna play this game for short periods at a time.

I'm enjoying the music that comes with it. It's a rock song with some nice drum rhythm, and I think it suits the game really well. As you progress you unlock new followers that have different abillities, and like I said, you upgrade them with the gold you collect. It starts of easy but it gets hard pretty quick. 

definitely a nice little game, but due to the repetitive grinding you might want to pick it up on sale or in a bundle. It depends on if you like that kind of thing or not.

La prise en main est facile avec le pad et on n'a de cesse de vouloir faire √©voluer notre bardbarre et son √©quipe pour sauver le village lors de ce jour terrible ou l'ennemi souhaite voir notre t√™te loin de notre corps. 

Apr√®s une petite dizaine d'heures j'ai r√©ussi √† collecter tous les succ√®s mais j'ai tout de m√™me envie de pers√©verer pour am√©liorer mes scores !

author: {'steamid': '76561198066669262', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1423316074}
review:
Brad the Barbarian has grown tired of the XP grind, but he can't stop the need to have to farm gold.
Bardbarian is a clever twist of taking elements from RPGs and Tower Defense into an action game where you are protecting your town's crystal from monsters, except that YOU are not. Brad decided he doesn't want to be a fighter, but a musician. So now he plays rock music. He summons warriors, temporarily boosts their stats, and stuns enemies with his music. The power of music eh?
There is a Campaign, Survival mode, and Endless (running as far as you can) mode. The last two are both challenges where you can compare your skill against your friends and the rest of the world, and also sources where you can earn gold to upgrade for the campaign. The campaign is pretty tough. Mainly because it will require a combination of skill, and the right upgrades from the countless times of playing.
You'll definitely get your money's worth buying this game, if this is the kind of thing you are into. If you like Tower Defense, and you don't mind working the hours needed to earn that "in-game" money, you'll probably dig this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999485050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1420349600}
review:
Bardbarian √© um jogo bastante divertido e desafiador , no estilo tower defense.

Voc√™ controla um Bardo que ao toca seu machado invocando in√∫meros tipos de criaturas que possuem uma habilidade diferente, fazendo sua pr√≥pria estrategia para vencer as hordas de inimigos que vem a cada round.
Com seu machado voc√™ tamb√©m pode usar tr√™s poderes diferentes , como aumentar o ataque , defesa, e velocidade de movimento o que ajudam muito ao longo do gameplay.

Apesar de ser divertido o jogo se torna facil ao longo do seu desenrolar , sendo apenas necess√°rio fazer upgrades no personagem para zerar o jogo com facilidade o que torna quase imposs√≠vel ser atingido pelos inimigos.

Concluindo Barbarian √© um jogo bem feito, apesar de n√£o ter historia alguma torna uma experiencia bacana a experimentar, principalmente aos jogares que optam a jogar jogos offline que √© o principal foco do jogo.

Para n√£o se arrepender de comprar o jogo aguarde uma promo√ß√£o, porque o jogo realmente √© uma otima op√ß√£o para entrar na sua lista de games na steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975183383', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1677694421}
review:
Bardbarian es un juego simple y ameno, bueno para echar ratos sin pensar demasiado y relajarte un poco. 

Con una mecanica simple de oleadas de enemigos, encarnas a un bardo guerrero que utiliza su hacha-la√∫d para entonar solos de guitarra. Con ellos puedes invocar aliados que te seguir√°n y atacar√°n a tus enemigos, y tambien puedes potenciar temporalmente a tu grupo para que haga mas da√±o, tenga mas armadura o sea mas r√°pido.
El objetivo del juego es ir venciendo oleada tras oleada (hasta un m√°ximo de 20) a todos los enemigos para proteger la gema del pueblo, la cual si es destruida, dar√° la partida por terminada. Cada 5 oleadas aperecer√° un jefe que te pondr√° las cosas dif√≠ciles.
El oro que recoges te sirve para comprar potenciadores permanentes tanto para todas tus habilidades como para mejorar las caracteristicas de tus aliados y de los edificios del pueblo.

Podr√≠a catalogar Bardbarian como una especie de tower defense, aunque aqui no puedes colocar trampas ni armas, tan solo llevar contigo un numero limitado de aliados. La energ√≠a o man√° del juego son notas musicales, que consigues derrotando enemigos o gener√°ndolas autom√°ticamente manteniendote quieto en el sitio.

Los gr√°ficos son muy graciosos, muy estilo cartoon. Tiene una variedad adecuada de enemigos con diferentes comportamientos y tipos de ataque, y los jefes son duros de pelar. La musica es buena, no se hace repetitiva y tiene mucho ritmo. Le da mucha gracia al juego.
Como extra posee dos modos de juegos alternativos, uno de supervivencia, donde debes aguantar todo lo que puedas sin poder invocar aliados (solo los recoges segun van apareciendo) y uno de carrera, donde debes intentar llegar lo mas lejos posible huyendo de un muro de bestias y esquivando enemigos y disparos.

Bardbarian no tiene mayor pretensi√≥n que hacer pasar un buen rato, siendo entrenido, dificil hasta cierto punto. No espereis un juegazo triple A, pero si teneis muchos ratos libres sin nada que hacer y os apetece una partidita, estar√≠a bien probarlo. Si lo comprais en una rebaja, mejor que mejor.

Valoraci√≥n: 6,5 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198067763494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1450, 'last_played': 1421273587}
review:
das spiel macht spa√ü, die idee mit musik die einheiten zu beschw√∂ren, damit diese f√ºr einen k√§mpfen k√∂nnen ist noch relativ unverbraucht. die musik ist ziemlich gut und die level sind fordernd aber niemals unfair. allerdings, wird es ab tag 2 insbesondere in der welle nach dem gro√üen zwischengegner schon verdammich schwer, selbst in leicht. es fehlt auch ein wenig die abwechslung. vielleicht w√§re ein multiplayer mit mehr gegnern drin gewesen. und ein gro√üer schwachpunkt ist ganz klar der kristall. klar, ziel ist es den kristall so gut es geht zu besch√ºtzen, weil man ja sonst verliert wenn der kristall zerst√∂rt wird. aber ich finds schon bissel bl√∂de, dass im LEICHTEN modus selbst die schw√§chsten gegner so ziemlich genauso viel schaden machen k√∂nnen, wie die st√§rkeren gegner. das h√§tte man echt besser regulieren k√∂nnen. was mich aber wirklich st√∂rt ist die tatsache, dass es keine m√∂glichkeit gibt den kristall in irgendeiner form reparieren zu k√∂nnen. man kann doch seine eigene energie auch wieder herstellen, warum dann nicht auch die des kristalls?! man k√∂nnte ja z.b. gegen einen bestimmten geldbetrag einen energiepunkt des kristalls wieder aufladen. oder man gibt z.b. in der schmiede den auftrag gegen einen bestimmten geldbetrag den kristall wenigstens zum teil reparieren zu lassen. ich finde so w√§re das spiel wesentlich fairer. so aber muss man, wenn kurz nicht aufpasst und z.b. zum mittag der kristall schon besch√§digt wurde, bis zum ende des spiels diesen schaden mitnehmen und noch mehr aufpassen, als man ohnehin schon muss was das spielen schon ziemlich erschwert und etwas an spielspa√ü einb√º√üen l√§sst.

aber trotz dieses doch recht gro√üen schwachpunkst, √ºberwiegt der spielspa√ü und wer auf tower defense spiele steht ist hier genau richtig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171050195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1420951995}
review:
Hardwork steering with the keyboard.  may be better with a pad.

Its a throw away tower defence, which are 10 a penny all over the web and usually free on the flash game sites.  Hugely overpriced at the standard steam price.

played better TDs - this is a bit gimmicky, saying that seems there  are a lot of upgrades you could get addicted to trying to obtain.   So possibly a bit of a time sink if your're that way inclined.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961141742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1421009496}
review: This is a pure gem for every beard and metal fan. It feels like a tower defense and the upgrades really make it rewarding. The survival mode and the run-away mode are fantastic if you've had enough of the story mode. 11/10, would pay again for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086162912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1420883299}
review:
This is a game that prioritizes avatar strength over skill. No matter how skillfull you are, you cannot progress in the game without buying upgrades with coins. You'll simply be steamrolled. 

In terms of skill, there's not much involved. And that just defies the point of playing a game to me. This would probably be better suited as a free mobile game. It's really not worth $7.99

Still, I offer props for the decent soundtrack and artwork.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998576786', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1427888306}
review:
BardBarian is the typical game that someone plays once in a while when is bored or just want to have some fun.

It has a story mode, with 4 chapters/20 levels, a survival mode, and a "run as long as you can" mode, that increases the gameplay length, which it's something positive.

Basically, you just use the keyboard or gamepad to control Bard, and recruit other characters to fight for you. 
They will stick with Bard and they will automatically attack the enemies.
No, you can't attack with Bard, the only thing you can do is to use some specials to increase the damage, defense or speed of your characters.

But it's fun anyway. 
You can unlock and combine multiple characters, each one with his special ability/attack.

I acquired this game on Humble Bundle, so it was very cheap. 
And it came with android version too, which is very solid and enjoyable like the PC Version.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965063903', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1420400495}
review:
[u]Bardbarian Review[/u]

[u]Gameplay[/u]
Das Spielprinzip von Bardbarian gleicht einer Art von Tower Defense. Das Spiel kommt jedoch ohne Tower aus. Der Held selbst erf√ºllt die Funktion des Supporters. Er l√§sst sich frei √ºber das Spielfeld bewegen und verst√§rkt die Truppen mit diversen Zaubern oder kann Gegnermassen mit einem Finisher stunnen. Um den Held sammeln sich die angeheuerten Truppen und dienen als bewegliche Tower um die Gegnermassen zu vernichten. Dabei muss der Held diese zu den Gegnern steuern und auch den Angriffen ausweichen.

[u]Story[/u]
Eine Story ist per se nicht vorhanden. Es gibt eine Art Kampagne, die sich √ºber 4 Abschnitte verteilt und nach jedem Abschnitt wartet ein Boss. Das Spiel kann in einem normalen Modus und in einem schweren (Insane) Modus gestartet werden. Neben der Kampagne gibt es auch noch andere Spielmodi, wie einen Survival Modus.

[u]Langzeitmotivation[/u]
Das Spiel wei√ü durchaus auch auf lange Sicht zu motivieren. Mit verdientem Gold werden die Truppen, die Stadt, oder auch der Held aufgewertet. Die verschiedenen Spielmodi motivieren neben der Kampagne zus√§tzlich und bieten quasi endloses Gameplay, da sowohl Survival, als auch der Running Modus kein Ende besitzen. Die dazugeh√∂rigen Steam Highscores und Erfolge spornen zu besseren Leistungen an.

[u]Fazit[/u]
Ich habe mir anfangs nicht viel erwartet und bin wirklich begeistert. Tower Defense mal anders und vorallem auch mit ordentlich Humor. Das Spiel nimmt sich nicht selbst ernst und h√§lt einen dauerhaft bei Laune. F√ºr kleines Geld kann man hier endlose Stunden Spa√ü haben. Ich finde das Spiel ist allerdings mehr etwas f√ºr zwischendurch. Dauerhaft suchteln artet dann doch in Monotonie aus.

[u]Anmerkung[/u]
Ein faden Beigeschmack hat das Spiel. Bei einigen (auch Freunden von mir) funktioniert das Spiel leider nicht, bzw. ist mit immensen Frameeinbr√ºchen verbunden. Dies h√§ngt wohl mit diversen Grafikkarten zusammen, die eine Funktion des Spieles nicht richtig unterst√ºtzen. Fundierte Listen bestehen indess leider nicht. Ist also wohl eher Gl√ºckssache. Da es bei mir l√§uft, habe ich allerdings nicht weiter nachgeforscht.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994863068', 'num_games_owned': 1004, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1420418810}
review:
[h1] El Tower Defense que seguramente elegir√≠a Eddie Riggs‚Ä¶ [/h1]

Brad esta harto de ser un barbaro, cansado del grindeo de XP decide perseguir su sue√±o de hacer musica en lugar de solamente derramar sangre, fusionando un laud con una vieja hacha se prepara para defender su pueblo... una vez mas.

Hay que aclarar que esta es una adaptaci√≥n de un juego de iOS, pero que no llega como un simple port sino que ademas incluye nuevos modos de juego y unidades √∫nicas para su versi√≥n de Steam directas de otros juegos indies (veremos a [b]Octodad, Super Meat Boy, ShellRazer e Isaac[/b] )

Este es un tower defense diferente a todos los dem√°s, lejos de poner unidades en un camino predeterminado uno re√∫ne su propio grupo para ir a combatir a los enemigos que llegaran desde 3 caminos; es simple, adictivo y se ve extraordinariamente bien.

Aunque son solo 20 niveles (mas un modo +), una dificultad insane y 2 modos alternativos en realidad es un juego bastante divertido y que te mantiene enganchado el tiempo suficiente hasta por lo menos obtener todos sus logros.

El √∫nico pero que le podr√≠a encontrar, debido a que fue pensado para m√≥viles, es que la m√∫sica llega a ser repetitiva despu√©s de una 6ta pasada... pero pueden solucionarlo poniendo el OST de [b]Brutal Legend[/b] de fondo (mi recomendaci√≥n) y ver√°n este peque√±o tower defense como un peque√±o gui√±o a las aventuras de aquel Roadie consentido de todos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989651867', 'num_games_owned': 1060, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1457390250}
review:
This game is pretty awesome in its simpleness.

This game is for the gamer who doesn't like to learn a ton of stuff only to be able to play the game propperly. Sometimes reffered to as the 'casual gamer'. 

Everyone has his moments when you're hungover, sick or just lazy and want to play a game, but don't want to read books about the fluffin' story. This game is just that. Fun, upgrades, simple and original.

The graphics are okay and it's absolutely worth the money.

Get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144974149', 'num_games_owned': 3847, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1606374852}
review:
Brutal Legend + Plants vs Zombies

Unlike Brutal Legend, Bardbarian is honest about what it is (the irony... because it‚Äôs a mobile port...mobile games are prone to neglect mentioning just how expensive they are; not really honest... anyone? Jokes); there is no open-world or sidequests tacked on***
Unlike Plants vs Zombies, you are free to move about; not bound to setting up your towers/plants.

You are Brad, a barbarian who has rigged his axe into a lute. Monsters are attacking the village. You use your axe/lute (so "axe") to call companions; you've further solo's to buff yourself and those followers. A dynamic conga-line, you weave between enemies' projectiles, enabling your companions to return fire. You collect Gold (you can buy a Ratcoon to collect the loot for you) to purchase upgrades.

Very addicting.

***There are two other game modes in addition to the Campaign:
--Endless plants you into the thick of it; you only have your three Buff solo's at your disposal. Companions/Health randomly drop. The challenge is to recruit those Companions and not have them die THE SECOND they start following you. The game claims that this is a good mode for farming gold. Too bad your Ratcoon is absent; So sad that Companions (your only means of dispatching enemies) survive for mere seconds. Totally unfair, in my opinion.
--Escape has you running from a wall of darkness. No companions to worry about, no strategy in using solo's; strictly a runner mode - one hit kills you. It's much more fun than Endless, though hardly related to the main game.

Parting Words: 
Town Drunk's barf slows down enemies; 
Super Meat Boy and Octodad are unlockable companions.
The HUD is too big, even though the UI is said to have been "revamped."



...I just now read "About This Game":
"An awesome Rock/Metal original soundtrack by Maximum Satan "
...why...j-just why?... Damn :/

EDIT 2: Get on Insane Mode ASAP and farm Escape; that's where the money is. Granted, I think the prices of Upgrades scale with the larger amount of gold you receive, but progress still seems to go faster than it does in Normal Mode(?)

review:
Odeio jogos "grind-to-win". Ficar repetindo a mesma coisa, wave ap√≥s wave √© um saco. Compra itens mais fortes, avance mais waves, morra, volte....ahhhhhhhhhhhh.

Peguei esse jogo por indica√ß√£o de amigos. E devo dizer, √© uma dos MELHORES grind-to-win que eu j√° joguei na vida.

Engra√ßado, desafiador e com muitos solos de guitarra (ou nesse caso "Axe-Lute"), voc√™ se diverte muito e quando percebe o game acabou. Quer dizer, a hist√≥ria principal... voc√™ pode ficar jogando at√© terminar tudo, mas eu n√£o tenho esse saco, j√° que terminei o principal.

Em suma, um √≥timo jogo. Bem simples, criativo e um excelente passatempo. Recomendo fortemente.

review:
Un Tower Defense m√°s;

La curva de dificultad, como en todos los juegos de este g√©nero, se puede romper con facilidad. Una vez descubres que unidad est√° OP y mejoras 4 par√°metros b√°sicos, puedes llegar al final sin ninguna dificultad.

Bastante repetitivo, muy pocos enemigos y todos muy iguales, solo una de las magias es √∫til, el resto est√°n de relleno, como el 90% de las unidades y mejoras; me ha dado apenas 3 o 4 horas de juego, conseguir todos los logros no es dificil, es largo... y repetitivo... por tanto aburrido.

No recomiendo pagar por un juego como este, cuando no tiene nada innovador y puedes encontrar cientos parecidos y hasta mejores en webs gratuitas como Minijuegos

review:
Simples e Divertido. Praticamente um jogo de celular, Bardbarian tem uma √≥tima trilha sonora e uma mec√¢nica simples o suficiente para uma boa distra√ß√£o. Voc√™ encarna um b√°rbaro-bardo que tem que ajudar a defender sua cidade (ou o cristal gigante da sua cidade) de hordas de inimigos clich√™s dos mundos de fantasia medieval, fazendo melhorias na sua equipe de "summons" conforme joga e adquire gold. review:
TL;DR; BiorƒÖc pod uwagƒô cenƒô - bardzo gorƒÖco polecam! (zw≈Çaszcza, ≈ºe do 1.01.2015 jest czƒô≈õciƒÖ dolarowego progu w obecnym Humble Bundle).

A czym jest Bardbarian ? Zabawnym tower-defense! Niby nic wielkiego, ale wciƒÖga jak odkurzacz :) Wiele dostƒôpnych postaci, ≈õcie≈ºki ulepsze≈Ñ i rozbudowy miasta oraz grind - po lepsze postacie, dodatki itd itp. 
Sympatyczna grafika. D≈ºwiƒôk robi siƒô monotonny po jakim≈õ czasie, ale c√≥≈º... Za te pieniƒÖdze zabawa przednia. Polecam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043840511', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1419628569}
review:
This is a fun game. You can play it in a lot of different ways.
Each run you do is different, not because of the enemies because those are stactic, but because you'll learn to change your squad.
One other good thing about this game is that you can also play 2 game modes. One is survival and the other is side-scroll infinite running. Both are great fun.
If this ins't enough to convince you then let's me tell you about the Insane mode too. It's much more aggresive than normal mode but it's also a lot a fun.
If you buy this game you will have good fun. 100% assured.

review:
A real fun pick up and play game.  The progression of leveling up abilities for you, the town and your group draws you in for one more go after each failure.

Only minor draw back is the game tells you during the tutorial that its best to play the game with a controller which is fine for me but then when your back in the menus you really need to go back to using mouse controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142138359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1659976787}
review:
Bardbarian lo si pu√≤ tranquillamente definire un tower defense, ma con una struttura particolare. Infatti vi immedisimerete in un barbaro che grazie alla sua ascia/liuto esegue varie tipologie di assoli che chiameranno truppe di rinforso o attiveranno abilit√† del personaggio.
Io lo adoro, i comandi sono semplici ma il gioco non lo √® per niente, dopo i primi livelli di tutorial diventer√† una vera sfida. Andando avanti con il gioco inoltre si sbloccheranno varie truppe, ognuna con le sue caratteristiche.
CONSIGLIATO!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064783185', 'num_games_owned': 854, 'num_reviews': 275, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1419348224}
review: Es un juego bastante entretenido y de mec√°nica simple: Sobrevive a oleadas de enemigos invocando a guerreros que luchen por ti. El √∫nico punto malo que le veo, al menos bajo mi punto de vista, es que el propio Brad el b√°rbaro (muy original) no puede atacar, solo invocar y ofrecer mejoras temporales a los aliados. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970564469', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1419444445}
review:
OK So my wife bought this game and I didn't really know what to expect.  She picked it up and asked me to try it.  At first I thought it was a action game like castle crashers so the first moment in the game I was a little confused.  But it's a really interesting mix of a bunch of different types of games.  No joke I lost 2 days to this game.  Very very very fun.  The progression is really well done in this game too.  There are tons of boosts, upgrades, and characters to unlock.  Very high replayability.  

I've never heard of this game before but really glad my wife picked it up.  Fun stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007709498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1489949988}
review: I love the soundtrack-- sound effects are amazingly well-integrated with gameplay so the the bard's guitar solos feel native instead of disruptive.  The controller support is great, and the powerups unlocked offer a quick, but complelling reason to keep playing the same waves of monsters in the same setting; ultimately this is a great casual action game for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970119710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1590112595}
review: A glorified flash game. There's some depth there, but in the end it's just to tease you into repeating the same simple gameplay ad-infinitum. It feels like a title that would normally be asking for microtransactions. It's enjoyable enough for what it is, but ultimately not something I'll ever come back to.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988994736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 1353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1312, 'last_played': 1414703243}

review:
El mecanismo del juego es b√°sicamente el de un Tower Defense, como ya se ha comentado por aqu√≠, pero con algunos toques que lo convierten en un juego original y con mucho sentido del humor.

Por este precio lo recomiendo totalmente. Un juego ideal para cuando quieres pasar un rato con el ordenador para relajarte con algo divertido. Se aprende jugar muy r√°pido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050555704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1419181100}
review:
Fun.  Simple.  Addictive.

Sat in my library for quite some time before i started it up.  Really fun game.  Very cute.  Easy to learn, harder to master kind of thing.  If you like rogue-like and binding of Isaac type games just buy it.  It wont let you down.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996501124', 'num_games_owned': 7813, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1417751276}
review:
A neat PvZ style tower defense game featuring many guitar solos and co-starring Super Meat Boy. Also serves as a prime example of a mobile port that makes the effort to transition over to PC instead of just dumping a game with mouse based touch conrols on here.

Want to see some gameplay? Check out my Bundle Buys video on the title! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vUfhE6ubRVQ

author: {'steamid': '76561198113818671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1584821034}
review:
Great concept although gameplay and ambiance are repetitive. Most drones are useless. Sadly the music is also repetitive..

Good side is that all achievements are easy to get, requiring only time and patience.

It's a good game to relax and see your minions do their job.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140296598', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1456153451}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062794950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1413519947}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972599802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1412616723}
review: Not a  tower defence game; more like a bullethell game with the addition of hireable drones that follow you and shoot for you. Interesting concept but does not offer more than 2-3 hours of interesting gameplay and is rather grindy past that. If it is more than 75% off on a sale it might be worth, otherwise not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047467292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1447798444}
review:
You play as Brad, the bardbarian (Sorry dyslexics). The goal is simple: defend the town crystal in a wave-defense system. There are quite a few different units to unlock by getting to higher waves. The enemies have a good variation in strength and speed. Art is simple cartoon style, but fits well and goes well with the game and the music is well done. You can also have a pet raccoon. 

Would recommend playing bradbarbadarian.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117295623', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1436079314}
review:
This game is amazing. The art style in this game is appealing to the eye, and the large selection of classes is a huge bonus. This game should be one that everyone tries at least once. Amazing music, amazing gameplay.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995740295', 'num_games_owned': 1396, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1410387775}
review:
+ Interesting concept
+ Decent artstyle

- Music gets repetitive
- Game is a bit too grindy
- Some units are worthless even upgraded.

review: Addicting little twin stick shooter game where u have to survive the waves of enemies and survive the day. There is a bit of depth with the upgrades u can buy for your main character then unlock new units and upgrade them as well. Depending which units u choose for your little party can make a big difference on how u play. its not a huge game but well worth the small price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970444572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1415944578}
review:
Bardbarian is a somewhat fun game that mixes elements of bullet-hell and tower defense.  The gameplay feels interesting, at first, but lacks more than a few hours of gameplay.  I beat the game on Insane difficulty in about 3 hours.  I have basically everything unlocked and maxed except for a few units (which would require grinding for another hour or so).  Even on Insane difficulty, I found myself standing at the front gate killing enemies before they could even get a single shot off.  Eventually you'd hit a wave / boss that's a brick wall and would require you to die and upgrade (sometimes a few times) before you could pass it.  If the developer could smooth out this progression, it would feel much more exciting to play.

Besides all of the cons I've listed above, the game is some sort of Flash port.  I have a gaming PC, and I get about 3 frames per second on the main title in windowed mode.  In fullscreen mode, the main screen doesn't even load and the game crashes.  I spent the first few hours after purchasing this game trying to solve this problem.  The game is littered with other bugs as well.

I would avoid this game, personally, but if you like grindy games, I suppose I could recommend it at $1 or in a bundle somewhere.

2/5 Stars

author: {'steamid': '76561198059528485', 'num_games_owned': 650, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1418576952}
review:
Awesome game.
Defend the tower (or the crystal) with you summons. Play some riffs to bring your summons.
You always start from 'wave1' and work your way up. You can pay (in-game currency) to start at another wave (if you reached that wave already).
You can buy powerups, unlocks summons (some of them from other games), upgrade your 'town'.
Easy gameplay, nice cartoon graphics, nice soundtrack.
It's a funny game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060373295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1413323760}
review:
I picked this game up while it was on sale and I have to say it was the best $1.50 I ever spent.

I have been playing Tower Defense games since before the concept really took off and the uniqueness this one brings to the table was well worth what time/money I spent playing it and I still go back to this one every once in a while!

review:
Bardbarian ist ein sehr gelungener Mix aus TD und einer Art Plattformer. Sehr sch√∂ne Ideen in Sachen aufleveln, knackiger Schwierigkeitsgrad und zahreiche Einheiten, wobei nicht alle wirklich hilfreich sind. 
Im Gro√üen und Ganzen ein sehr sch√∂nes, kreatives und witziges Spielchen f√ºr zwischendurch mit hoher Langzeitmotivation. Empfohlen auch f√ºr Leute, die keine absoluten eingefleischten Fans des TD - Genres sind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066271169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1415595615}
review:
This game is tons of fun! You can easily get lost in it for a good amount of time.

Although It sort of has a grindy feel to it, kill enemies - get coins - die - upgrade - fight more, etc.. It is very fun and can be quite challenging as you get towards the harder enemies before you've upgraded your hero and his units. It is quite rewarding though, as you try to survive and unlock more characters and better stats for your group and battle area. 

Good Fun, Do Recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032636062', 'num_games_owned': 2817, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1415010769}
review:
Personal Rating: 8 of 10

A different twist to Tower Defense with RPG elements. You basically controls a Bard which summons characters to your side to try and stop incoming waves of enemies. I know this was originally a mobile game but the PC port was great with different resolutions, balanced gameplay (upgrades are purchased with in game earned coins), keyboard supported plus 3 addtional units.

The reason I only gave this game an 8 instead of a full 10 was because I think it still lacked of content such as having more heroes, items, skills or perhaps, longer campaign. After completing the campaign, you can still replay them to earn cash or play the unending mode. The unending mode however automatically resume on the level you last died and it can be frustating specially when you cannot fully summon all units at once to resume but the enemies comes in hordes. 

I do look forward to Bardbarian II with more witty ideas and content to the game from the developers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018976394', 'num_games_owned': 1692, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1414916566}
review:
Primero de todo, es una especie de tower defense y segundo, me molan mucho este tipo de juegos, de ir consiguiendo oro para comprar mejoras y cada vez resultarte m√°s f√°cil hacerlo todo. Pero tiene algo bueno, y es que no se te hace f√°cil, una vez terminas la campa√±a, la cual tardar√°s sus horitas, se te desbloquear√° el modo Insane y ah√≠ empieza la fiesta. 

Muchas unidades con sus diferentes ataques cada una, mejoras para el personaje y la ciudad, 4 modos de juego y muy buena m√∫sica que aunque se repite bastante a lo largo del juego, en ning√∫n momento la he tenido que desconectar porque me estuviese rayando.

Los modos de juego son:
Campa√±a - 20 oleadas con 4 boses.
Dia 2 - A partir de la oleada 21 y hasta donde puedas llegar.
Infinito - Tipo endless run, corriendo sin parar a ver que record consigues.
Supervivencia - Oleadas de enemigos y no puedes comprar unidades, solo encontrarlas.

No los cuento como modos porque son lo mismo pero m√°s dif√≠cil, pero tambi√©n podr√≠amos a√±adir lo mismo pero en el modo Insane, donde los enemigos quitan m√°s vida, lanzan m√°s habilidades, se mueven m√°s r√°pido, aguantan m√°s, etc...

Si tengo que ponerle alguna pega al juego, ser√≠a que no tenga un bot√≥n como en los Sims para acelerar el tiempo, porque cuando est√°s desbloqueando las cosas y tienes que repetir una y otra vez misiones para conseguir oro se hace pesado. Y quiz√° tambi√©n alguna opc√≠on para eliminar unidades invocadas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993780180', 'num_games_owned': 2222, 'num_reviews': 270, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1413361101}
review: I'm not sure why everyone calls this tower defense, since it plainly isn't.  Maybe none of them know what a shmup is.  This is a game where your firing is largely out of your control, but you try to dodge around large numbers of projectiles, while manuevering so that your shooting kills enemies.  This is a very fun take on the schmup genre, that I highly reccomend for the price

author: {'steamid': '76561198010999954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1422650520}
review:
Not the kind of game I ordinarily would have picked up, but after watching my girlfriend play it I decided to give it a try and I'm glad I did.

Gameplay sort of resembles a tower defense game in that there are hordes of attacking enemies, but instead of placing towers you defending it. You do this by controlling the main character who is a barbarian turned bard (hence the name) who summons a party of characters (of up to three different types) that follow him around and do all the heavy lifting.

Between its humorous nature, the upgrades, and the increasing difficulty it remains enjoyable despite, or maybe because of, its relative simplicity.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994471459', 'num_games_owned': 978, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1414046886}
review:
Cheap yet fresh! Like a bag of tomatoes that taste surprisingly sweet.

You are the tower, set up your party and walk around as your buddies listen to your jams and kill the never-ending horde, so it goes.

If you're in the mood for a Tower Defense but are tired of Tower Defense, then play this Defense game. Plus it has Isaac and Meat Boy as a crappy unit: 11/10

review:
Good fun.  Could have been better or more varied.  Shows its colours as a mobile port.
